column1: Owning several devices, or living with other people who own more than one device can pose some problems, especially when it comes to charging them. Here are the most common problems:
1) Not enough electrical outlets to charge all your devices
column2: family and friends have to take turns charging.

column1: 2) You’re forced to charge from a laptop or desktop USB port, which can take more time especially when charging many devices at once.
3) Even if there are multiple ports or outlets, the USB cables make a real mess (an absolute horror for all you neat freaks)!
Fishbone - Just The Right Solution, At The Right Time
Despite all the choices available, Fishbone is the only USB charging station that helps keep the cables organized, charges fast, and has a sleek, modern look.
Fishbone Charging Station is made to make it easier to keep your devices’ cables neat and organized while charging. Just connect the cables, and wrap the cables around Fishbone’s body.
Fishbone’s smart charging ports with a combined maximum output of 6.8A will automatically detect and adjust the power output to suit your device’s charging needs, whether it’s Android or an iDevice

column2: >

column1: You probably own many devices, all of which need to be charged. That’s why we designed the Fishbone to charge up to 5 devices of almost any size or weight.

Only 6 months ago, our team – Trendlift - set out to design a product that will be a huge improvement over the USB charging hubs available in the market. Our team identified problems with USB hubs that include messy cables, inefficient charging and bulky, unattractive design. As a result, it inspired us to create Fishbone – the USB charging station that keeps cables neat, automatically adjusts its power output for efficient charging and looks really cool!

Many processes are involved in getting the Fishbone USB Charging Station made, packaged, and ready for sale at your favorite store. That’s why we need your support. We need funding to have the right materials, machines, and packaging ready, as well as get the needed certifications. With your help, we believe we can make the Fishbone a reality.

Covering our bases to ensure that Fishbone Charging Station is manufactured right is a top priority for us. We’ve heavily prototyped and tested the Fishbone Charging Station and since we’re located in Hong Kong, we’re extremely close to our manufacturer in Shenzhen. This manufacturer in particular specializes in producing USB stations and has the experience working with other electronics brands worldwide.

For added assurance, we’ve added a production consultant who has years upon years of experience helping brands in the US manufacture mobile electronics in China to our team. That said, as with any business venture, making and shipping products come with its own share of risks. That’s why we’ll keep you informed should we encounter any challenges that prevent us from hitting our timeline. With our experienced team and knowhow, we’ll be sure to deliver products to spec!

A million color a high quality speaker, lattice graphic, recording, alarm, and phone notification. All of these amazing features into one glowing mushroom, easily controlled by App. Here we have, the Romi. Handy and adorable gadget for your family.

The adjustment of the light color and brightness of Romi is very easy with free companion app. Just pick a color from the color wheel. Romi will give you a real-time feedback while you paint its lampshade.
A romantic dinner, a horror film or a gathering, Romi lamp offers 16 million colors to create a perfect mood for any situations. ​​

Apart from being just a lamp, Romi also boasts of an integrated speaker. Sync your music source with the Romi to have your own personal light show pulsating to the rhythm of the music. The lattice graphics on the body of Romi could change with the music.

Stream from all of your favorite music apps and content sources including Apple Music, Spotify, Netflix, YouTube and more.

Set your unique bitmap images on your phone and let your love be seen through Romi lamp. You could set maximum 6 bitmap images and display on Romi lamp. It can be your love words to your families, random sketches with your kids and even a logo or slogan!

Romi features a 360° rotating head made out of soft BPA free silicone. You will enjoy squeezing it. It feels good, like stress relieving. And the excellent heat resistance of silicone rubber is another plus when it comes to your safety.

Leave a voice and interact with your love even when you're out. A more gentle and way to express your feelings. (*alarm &
column2:
Record function requires. )

Your toddler is afraid of the dark? Your kid gets up at night to use the bathroom? Romi is designed for your restorative bedtime. Set Romi to ‘breath mode’. The intensity of Romi will dim in the slightest glow and turn to various colors along breath beat. A soft, reassuring presence all night long. We restored four light scenes in the companion App. Go to explore yourself.

 

Idea Show is a branch of Design Identification(Singapore) PTE Ltd. in China that founded in 2007. We manufactures creative electric home gadgets.Romi is a portmanteau word of 'Romantic' and 'Lumination' which means a scene light for romantic occasions.

 

Romi is on production stage now and the estimated finish time is November! Support our Indiegogo campaign and get Romi on time! 

 

How does Romi charge? How long do the batteries last?
Romi has a in-built 4000mah battery that lasts up to 2 days on full strength. It is charged through a micro USB cable and takes about 6 hours for a full charge.

What is the lightsource in Romi?

Romi has 5 electrically efficient LED lights. LEDs don’t produce heat and are cool to the touch.

What products can Romi work with?
Romi can work with all the devices that have Bluetooth either Apple devices or Android, Windows or any other products.

Does Romi work with Spotify, Tuneln, etc? 

Yes, once your phone is connected via Bluetooth, you will be able to choose Romi as an audio output for Spotify, or any other music App.

When will I receive my order?

The first product shipment is expected to be in the first week of November, 2016.

>FIRST STRETCH GOAL!!!

Xibot has been featured on many major media include Yahoo, CNET, ZDNet etc. We have raised more than $30000. Without your great support, we cannot make it! Really appreciate it! Now many backers inquire about stretch goals. We think it's time to release our first stretch goals: we will offer two colors of Xibot cute ears. In addition to pink, a blue one is an option. So please leave a comment on our campaign for your color choice.

We also released 1000 special offer, you can share with your friends. We will offer free USB cable to you, please check the referral program details on our campaign page.

column1: If you share our indiegogo campaign on your facebook, twitter or google+, and it brings one of your friends back to us, we will send you a USB cable FREE OF CHARGE! The one click share button is on the left of the campaign video and we can track it from indiegogo dashboard.
Having trouble waking up in the morning? Let XIBOT be your wake-up assistant. She will gently call your name and say good morning to you. A brand new day is about to start!
Wanna know what to wear during the day? Nobody is prepared to be a drowned rat… XIBOT will forecast the weather as considerately as possible, reminding you of temperature, moisture, humidity, etc.

E-mails, messages, phone calls, shopping list… Everyday, a lot of tasks are pending. What if we forget one important task? What if we mess it up?  What if we don’t understand the sophisticated operating system on smartphones? With an easy-to-use feature and interface, XIBOT can act as a personal assistant in our lives. She can help you connect to your family and friends quickly and easily. Having XIBOT by your side, you just can’t imagine how convenient life will be.

With Wi-Fi connected to Xibot, you can monitor your house anywhere and anytime. She can guard your house when nobody is home. Or sneak peak what your kids or pets do and how they behave when you are not present. Perhaps you will soon find out why candies in the fridge are missing for no reason.

XIBOT is a bedtime storyteller, letting kids have fun and be prepared for sleep. XIBOT may even share with you what she has experienced to make you laugh. By establishing an intimate relationship with XIBOT,  kids will have a smart and brave companion in growth.

One-tap video chat feature is developed to minimize operating steps to just one. Face-to-face interaction between parents and kids is then easily achieved. Moving feature built inside breaks through limitation of distance and space. You can remotely control XIBOT with the app on your smartphone, wherever you are, at home or office, domestically or internationally, to enjoy family fun. Simultaneously, interactive fun is enriched with animal stickers and voice changer.

column5: >Smart Photography and Auto-Share to Social Media

column1: Hands-free photography enables you to capture smiling faces and special moments. What makes XIBOT amazing is that she can help you auto-share photos to social media, and all your friends can see your status updates instantly.

column5: >When we are children, we always dream to have a companion, a smart robotic friend. So, when the team starts our company, we set a goal, to be the first brand in smart robotics and serve families worldwide. We miss the dream in our childhood, and we want to make children's dream come true, to have a robotic friend.

>Xibot is originally designed and the concept of edutainment is the DNA in product design and development. ""Loving Our Baby"" is proposed as the slogan, because we desire to express love to kids as sweet as parents. Lovingly and wholeheartedly, Xiaoxi Technology holds the entrepreneurial attitude of ""Patience Above Love"". Xiaoxi Technology aims to serve families worldwide: the combination of excellent children education resources and the concept of edutainment makes children grow up in a fun world.

>These days, social robot is a hot market direction. But most of the social robots are  either too expensive or unintelligent. After more than 10 years development, we work with Foxconn to bring the best quality and smart robot to the world. At the same time, we make the price as low as possible, to achieve our goal: bring a robotic member to every family!

Greetings! My name is Conor Teal, founder of Cargo Cabins (cargocabins.org) in Eugene, Oregon. In 2013, I acquired my BA degree from the University of Oregon in Planning, Public Policy, and Management. Since graduation, I have been working on designs for emergency and transitional housing for those living without shelter.

Given the deficiency in affordable housing options available to the thousands of unhoused people in Oregon, Cargo Cabins is in the process of establishing itself as a private 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with the goal of constructing studio cabins by re-purposing unused shipping containers.
Cargo Cabins believes that everyone deserves a safe place to sleep at night and it is our mission to provide self-sufficient housing for many of our unsheltered community members!

One proven solution to the rising cost of housing is the Tiny House Movement! After discovering many success stories from those who have made the transition from a single-family home mortgage to a debt-free tiny house, I quickly recognized the logic in this type of housing for those living without shelter and wish to make this a reality for more people.

There are a wide range of tiny houses already available for sale, from DIY plans to established tiny house construction businesses. I was attracted to the concept of shipping container housing for a number of reasons, but namely for their abundance in shipyards around the world. There are 100,000's of these containers lying unused in ports due to oversupply and shipping companies' preference for new units. The vast majority of these vacant containers are still water-tight and only have minor abrasions.

column2: >(Photo by Izabela Reimers via Flickr Creative Commons)

column1: There is an established industry of modifying containers into office spaces, student dorms, restaurants, hotels, and single-family housing. However, there is a supply gap in applying these for emergency and mobile housing, particularly for those who struggle to afford their housing costs and those living without any shelter at all!
The cost of housing is often the highest expense in a family's household, but we pay these high prices because we all know that shelter is a necessity for well-being. Nevertheless, for
millions of people around the world this expense has become unbearable
and they have been forced to seek out help from family, friends, and local social services organizations for
immediate shelter or they end up sleeping outside wherever space can be found...
According to the most recent Federal AHA report, on a single night in January 2013, there were 610,042 people experiencing
homelessness in the United States, including 394,698 people who were homeless in
sheltered locations and 215,344 people who were living in unsheltered locations... Even worse, nearly a quarter of the homeless population are aged 18 or under.

Chronic homelessness is a daily tragedy that we are all aware of yet we feel helpless to solve. The truth is this crisis can be solved quite easily and quickly with a coordinated effort by local governments and individuals like you thinking:
• Stack-able with no need for additional support structure up to 5 stories
• Severity of heat gain requires intensive insulation
• Proportion of single module creates confined living space
• Weight of container requires crane to move in place
• Some jurisdictions restrict the usage of containers as a structural component
be placed in many different climates. <b>Container
homes have been found in typically hot climates to extremely cold climates. Already water-tight
and built to handle heavy abuse, shipping containers offer an effective
structural support apparatus requiring only modest modifications. Simple insulation methods already exist to create a viable living space for a variety of lifestyles!
• 500 Watt Photovoltaic Solar Generator Kit by Grape Solar
Our goal is to use locally-sourced recycled materials wherever possible during the fabrication process! We
will only use energy-efficient electric appliances throughout. We also
intend to gather most of the building materials for this prototype cabin within 25 miles of the fabrication site, which will be determined soon!
The 3D models shown are merely representations of the final
result. The first cabin will be subject to interior placement
adjustments during construction, but will stay relatively close to the
We are hoping to raise $10,000 to build the move-in ready Cargo Cabins - Mobile1 model for an unhoused individual or couple in Eugene, OR!
• All collected funds will be used for: purchasing materials, metal
cutting/welding contractor labor costs, and city government permitting fees.
• We intend to partner with community members, local businesses, and
other nonprofit organizations to acquire material donations in order to
expedite construction of additional cabins and lower production costs.
• If the Mobile1 cabin is built under the $10,000 budget, the remaining

funds will be given to the recipient in the form of requested amenities to help them become self-reliant (For instance, prepaid cell phones and a PO Box address are a common request by unhoused individuals).
Our first model will be given to the local Eugene nonprofit organization, Opportunity Village Eugene (OVE).
They are also crowdfunding for a new housing site called: Emerald Village.
Please consider helping them meet their goal!
OVE has made national headlines for their creative
planning designs and successful efforts in helping community members get
off the streets and into their own homes:
CNN  |  ""CNN10: Better by Design"" July 5, 2014
Register Guard | ""Village Takes Root: Eugene's experiment in housing is achieving its goals"" June 21, 2014

As a new organization, Cargo Cabins is limited in production capacity, name recognition, and a lack of start-up capital. However, we have dedicated connections with many active community members and organizations in Eugene. We will have certified contractors lined up to make sure the houses are built to code. We also know where to acquire the recycled materials we need to build our first model, including a local source of used shipping containers.
The primary obstacle we are up against is capital funding...
We believe that crowdfunding is one of the best ways to finance public-benefit projects and so we are starting here with Indiegogo to make this happen!

We will apply for government grants, connect with foundations and businesses, and recruit dedicated individuals for sustaining contributions as soon as we finalize our selection of board members and receive IRS 501(c)(3) status as a nonprofit organization. Our website will also eventually accept online donations so that we can achieve our vision of ending homelessness here in Oregon and beyond!
Most shipping containers are made of rust-resistant Corten steel and have a

hardwood floor. Some units have floors treated with pressurized chemicals and therefore need to be removed and replaced with non-toxic, insulated flooring. Cargo Cabins will use bamboo flooring for its durability and its benefits as a renewable plant product.
How do you move a shipping container tiny house?

Mobile1 will be placed on 24' heavy-duty flatbed trailers to handle the weight of the containers and for mobility. There are a limited amount of trucks that can pull 5000+ lbs of weight, but a house will typically only need to be moved once by a professional transport group or vehicle rental and dropped off onto a site. If someone intends to move often, then a large truck is necessary and Cargo Cabins recommends a truck with a much higher tow capacity than the actual weight of the house and trailer.

How are container houses any different than glorified RVs?

Yes, the similarities between the two are overwhelming, however container houses are much more customizable, have a greater insulation value, built with mostly recycled materials, and Cargo Cabin's models will cost less per square foot than an equivalent-sized Recreational Vehicle.

Plus, container houses simply look better!

Where can you park a tiny house?
Private Property: A tiny house can be placed in a backyard, driveway, some city parking lots with monthly permits,

or wherever space that local and state laws support RVs.

Mobile Home Parks, RV Parks, and Campgrounds: The beauty of a tiny house is its mobility on trailers, so parking at RV campgrounds or public parks is often supported.

Off-Grid: A Cargo Cabins studio may be parked in very

remote locations, for instance in National Parks, since they are designed as self-sufficient units.  Greenhouses with hydroponic vegetable gardens can be placed on the roof for an even higher level of self-reliance.

How do you securely lock a cabin?

The Mobile1 cabin will not have modified swing doors thus allowing for standard container locking mechanisms to be used on them. These locks will be purchased locally and provided to all new homeowners. The installed front door will have a bolt lock and the rear glass sliding door will have a common Round Face Mortise lock.

How do I purchase a Mobile1 cabin for myself?

As a public benefit organization, Cargo Cabins will only build studios for unhoused individuals by donating the units to social services organizations who will maintain them as rentals or delegate ownership. All donations through this fundraiser will be dedicated for this purpose.
However, if you are interested in moving into a container cabin for yourself, then email Cargo Cabins and make a request for a private sale. For now, only requests made in Oregon will be possible.
If you have any other questions, please email Cargo Cabins at: admin@cargocabins.org!
Every $10,000 collected in this fundraiser will provide an unhoused individual or couple with their own home!

Nearly 15,000 people living in Oregon do not have access to stable shelter every night... We do not expect to place everyone in a tiny house, but we would like to provide as many people as we can with a home of their own!

Cargo Cabins intends to help build healthy compact city cores by developing self-sufficient affordable housing complexes on vacant publicly-owned lots.

All assets will be given to city authorities for management of these facilities at little expense to the public. Rent can be based on income and offer a new sustainable revenue source for struggling city government budgets. These complexes can be retrofitted and placed on-site in a fraction of
the time and cost of traditional stick-built apartments while still
exceeding current building efficiency codes.

Self-sufficiency measures for these developments will include: large solar photovoltaic arrays, on-site rainwater harvesting and filtration, personal storage units, geodesic dome greenhouses for communal hydroponic vegetable gardens, social services visitations, public transportation accessibility, and secure bicycle parking facilities.

We will apply regenerative design methods and help bring nature back
into our cities by planting new trees and community gardens. These units can be extremely
beneficial in natural disaster areas for emergency housing. Plus, the
structures can be disassembled and reassembled without wasteful

Other Ways You Can Help:

We all know household budgets are tight, so if you can't help financially then please attend your local neighborhood association or city council meeting and encourage community leaders to prioritize on developing respectable low-income housing!

There is no decent reason why we all must struggle to afford to live in our own homes. Consequently, hundreds of thousands of people in the United States have been forced out of stable housing when we all know:
Please help spread the word of the Cargo Cabins fundraising campaign and consider moving into your own tiny house as a realistic opportunity to live debt-free!
Visit our website at www.cargocabins.org for more information on the organization's mission and progress.

Greetings! My name is Conor Teal, founder of Cargo Cabins (cargocabins.org) in Eugene, Oregon. In 2013, I acquired my BA degree from the University of Oregon in Planning, Public Policy, and Management. Since graduation, I have been working on designs for emergency and transitional housing for those living without shelter.

Given the deficiency in affordable housing options available to the thousands of unhoused people in Oregon, Cargo Cabins is in the process of establishing itself as a private 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with the goal of constructing studio cabins by re-purposing unused shipping containers.
Cargo Cabins believes that everyone deserves a safe place to sleep at night and it is our mission to provide self-sufficient housing for many of our unsheltered community members!

One proven solution to the rising cost of housing is the Tiny House Movement! After discovering many success stories from those who have made the transition from a single-family home mortgage to a debt-free tiny house, I quickly recognized the logic in this type of housing for those living without shelter and wish to make this a reality for more people.

There are a wide range of tiny houses already available for sale, from DIY plans to established tiny house construction businesses. I was attracted to the concept of shipping container housing for a number of reasons, but namely for their abundance in shipyards around the world. There are 100,000's of these containers lying unused in ports due to oversupply and shipping companies' preference for new units. The vast majority of these vacant containers are still water-tight and only have minor abrasions.
(Photo by Izabela Reimers via Flickr Creative Commons)

There is an established industry of modifying containers into office spaces, student dorms, restaurants, hotels, and single-family housing. However, there is a supply gap in applying these for emergency and mobile housing, particularly for those who struggle to afford their housing costs and those living without any shelter at all!
The cost of housing is often the highest expense in a family's household, but we pay these high prices because we all know that shelter is a necessity for well-being. Nevertheless, for
millions of people around the world this expense has become unbearable
and they have been forced to seek out help from family, friends, and local social services organizations for
immediate shelter or they end up sleeping outside wherever space can be found...
According to the most recent Federal AHA report, on a single night in January 2013, there were 610,042 people experiencing
homelessness in the United States, including 394,698 people who were homeless in
sheltered locations and 215,344 people who were living in unsheltered locations... Even worse, nearly a quarter of the homeless population are aged 18 or under.

Chronic homelessness is a daily tragedy that we are all aware of yet we feel helpless to solve. The truth is this crisis can be solved quite easily and quickly with a coordinated effort by local governments and individuals like you thinking:
Significant cost reduction over standard stick-built
Easily customizable for individual site needs
Stack-able with no need for additional support structure up to 5 stories
Reuse of existing material (Low materials waste)
Severity of heat gain requires intensive insulation
Proportion of single module creates confined living space
Weight of container requires crane to move in place
Some jurisdictions restrict the usage of containers as a structural component
When appropriately retrofitted, container housing can
be placed in many different climates. Container
homes have been found in typically hot climates to extremely cold climates. Already water-tight
and built to handle heavy abuse, shipping containers offer an effective
structural support apparatus requiring only modest modifications. Simple insulation methods already exist to create a viable living space for a variety of lifestyles!
Structural Insulated Panels (SIPs) - Oriented Strand Board & XPS Foamboard
500 Watt Photovoltaic Solar Generator Kit by  Grape Solar
Our goal is to use locally-sourced recycled materials wherever possible during the fabrication process! We
will only use energy-efficient electric appliances throughout. We also
intend to gather most of the building materials for this prototype cabin within 25 miles of the fabrication site, which will be determined soon!
The 3D models shown are merely representations of the final
result. The first cabin will be subject to interior placement
adjustments during construction, but will stay relatively close to the
We are hoping to raise $10,000 to build the move-in ready Cargo Cabins - Mobile1 model for an unhoused individual or couple in Eugene, OR!
All collected funds will be used for: purchasing materials, metal
cutting/welding contractor labor costs, and city government permitting fees.
We intend to partner with community members, local businesses, and
other nonprofit organizations to acquire material donations in order to
expedite construction of additional cabins and lower production costs.
If the Mobile1 cabin is built under the $10,000 budget, the remaining

funds will be given to the recipient in the form of requested amenities to help them become self-reliant (For instance, prepaid cell phones and a PO Box address are a common request by unhoused individuals).
Our first model will be given to the local Eugene nonprofit organization, Opportunity Village Eugene (OVE).
They are also crowdfunding for a new housing site called: Emerald Village.
Please consider helping them meet their goal!
OVE has made national headlines for their creative
planning designs and successful efforts in helping community members get
off the streets and into their own homes:
Register Guard  |  ""Village Takes Root: Eugene's experiment in housing is achieving its goals"" June 21, 2014

As a new organization, Cargo Cabins is limited in production capacity, name recognition, and a lack of start-up capital. However, we have dedicated connections with many active community members and organizations in Eugene. We will have certified contractors lined up to make sure the houses are built to code. We also know where to acquire the recycled materials we need to build our first model, including a local source of used shipping containers.
The primary obstacle we are up against is capital funding...
We believe that crowdfunding is one of the best ways to finance public-benefit projects and so we are starting here with Indiegogo to make this happen!

We will apply for government grants, connect with foundations and businesses, and recruit dedicated individuals for sustaining contributions as soon as we finalize our selection of board members and receive IRS 501(c)(3) status as a nonprofit organization. Our website will also eventually accept online donations so that we can achieve our vision of ending homelessness here in Oregon and beyond!
What are shipping containers made of?
Most shipping containers are made of rust-resistant Corten steel and have a

hardwood floor. Some units have floors treated with pressurized chemicals and therefore need to be removed and replaced with non-toxic, insulated flooring. Cargo Cabins will use bamboo flooring for its durability and its benefits as a renewable plant product.
How do you move a shipping container tiny house?

Mobile1 will be placed on 24' heavy-duty flatbed trailers to handle the weight of the containers and for mobility. There are a limited amount of trucks that can pull 5000+ lbs of weight, but a house will typically only need to be moved once by a professional transport group or vehicle rental and dropped off onto a site. or wherever space that local and state laws support RVs.Mobile Home Parks, RV Parks, and Campgrounds: The beauty of a tiny house is its mobility on trailers, so parking at RV campgrounds or public parks is often supported.Off-Grid: A Cargo Cabins studio may be parked in very

The Mobile1 cabin will not have modified swing doors thus allowing for standard container locking mechanisms to be used on them. These locks will be purchased locally and provided to all new homeowners. The installed front door will have a bolt lock and the rear glass sliding door will have a common Round Face Mortise lock.How do I purchase a Mobile1 cabin for myself?

However, if you are interested in moving into a container cabin for yourself, then email Cargo Cabins and make a request for a private sale. For now, only requests made in Oregon will be possible.
If you have any other questions, please email Cargo Cabins at: admin@cargocabins.org!

column1: <div class=""redactor_ng-isolate-scope redactor_ng-pristine redactor_ng-valid redactor_editor"" dir=""ltr"" style=""display: inline !important
This is a story about historical preservation, yes, and more, because the story continues.

Living among remnants of an earlier era, one gets used to graceful decay of wooden structures, built sparingly as the times dictated. Here also, are more substantial structures, like the Keeler Train Station, admired for their endurance and rugged beauty.

But, it was the swimming pool that made me realize I was taking it all for granted. I had heard the story of how it was hand dug in the 1920s (33ft × 86ft and 5 feet deep). Slim Hernandez, a long-time Keeler resident, was part of the building crew. I've heard that Hollywood honchos, like Fatty Arbuckle, visited the favored watering hole. (It was the first and only pool in Inyo County for a time.)  An unconfirmed story has Johnny Weismuller, the original Tarzan, practicing for the Olympics here.

This tiny town of about 60 people now, is reported to have once been home to 5,000 at its height in the 1870s. But, people left as the mines played out, the Owens Lake dried up, the somewhat grand Keeler Hotel burned down, the railroad withdrew,  the two-room school house emptied, the pool closed and commerce vanished.

What remains is a beautifully profound quiet in what has been called a living ghost town. People amazingly stop by from all over the world and find something charming here. They photograph the unique scenes, including the abandoned swimming pool, ringed by a weathered fence, two pretty little ragtag buildings and the little bell tower without a bell.

So, the dream is to preserve the historic buildings at the pool and bring back the water in the style of a natural swimming pool. A shallow shelf is created for plants: 50% water garden, 50% swimming area. No chlorine, the plants do the work. There are amazing examples on the internet if you look up ""swimming pond"" or ""natural swimming pool.""
A picture is worth a thousand words. This is how they have done it in Ibiza, Spain at Can Marti.
But a dream such as this is not for the public, so says the state in these United States. Only a pool accompanied by a private home can be filtered this way.
Would it be worth it to build a Water Garden to British Natural Swimming Pool Standards? We'll let you decide.

column47: >We formed Keeler Early Era Preservation Society (KEEPS) ""To help preserve history and historic sites in Keeler."" For the children, we need to bridge the past and the future that they may know the full spectrum of history. We will work to archive documents and photos for posterity. For the many buildings from that bygone era, let the decisions rest with the individuals who have taken on the responsibility of private property ownership, but we stand ready to assist, if needed.

column30:
What You Get

With $15,000, we can bring the pool property back into community hands. That's the entire purchase price!

  • We opened escrow with $1,500, the result of our first round of fundraising.  http://igg.me/at/keelerpool

column1:
• The perks are intrinsic . . . something to warm your heart and give you goose bumps.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will donate the funds we raised to the Eastern California Museum.

    • The Impact

    A natural swimming pool on the edge of the storied Owens Lake will complement the work of many and create another restorative space:

    • Water is precious. We will take care of the artesian spring as a community.
    • Both cutting edge and old as the hills, working with nature will be applied here.

    Risks &
column2:
Challenges

We have a long way to go. Looking at the pool with two feet of dust sitting in the bottom, it is understandable that people are daunted.

  • We have talked to pool experts, and they say it is technically do-able.
  • One of our biggest challenges will be keeping the characterof the site and enhancing, not disturbing the quietude.

column1:
• Sharing the vision widely enough that natural support will materialize is our undertaking now.

    • Other Ways You Can Help

    Donations are great, but there are other important things, too:

    • We need to get the word out! Think far and wide. People who love history, railroads, mining, Hollywood, Owens Valley and Owens Lake, and Keeler fans (yes, we know you are out there.)
    • As well, it is a project that combines science (think water quality, horticulture) and  stewardship (think living waters and clean swimming).
This is a story about historical preservation, yes, and more, because the story continues.

Living among remnants of an earlier era, one gets used to graceful decay of wooden structures, built sparingly as the times dictated. Here also, are more substantial structures, like the Keeler Train Station, admired for their endurance and rugged beauty.

But, it was the swimming pool that made me realize I was taking it all for granted. I had heard the story of how it was hand dug in the 1920s (33ft × 86ft and 5 feet deep). Slim Hernandez, a long-time Keeler resident, was part of the building crew. I've heard that Hollywood honchos, like Fatty Arbuckle, visited the favored watering hole. (It was the first and only pool in Inyo County for a time.)  An unconfirmed story has Johnny Weismuller, the original Tarzan, practicing for the Olympics here.

This tiny town of about 60 people now, is reported to have once been home to 5,000 at its height in the 1870s. But, people left as the mines played out, the Owens Lake dried up, the somewhat grand Keeler Hotel burned down, the railroad withdrew,  the two-room school house emptied, the pool closed and commerce vanished.

What remains is a beautifully profound quiet in what has been called a living ghost town. People amazingly stop by from all over the world and find something charming here. They photograph the unique scenes, including the abandoned swimming pool, ringed by a weathered fence, two pretty little ragtag buildings and the little bell tower without a bell.

So, the dream is to preserve the historic buildings at the pool and bring back the water in the style of a natural swimming pool. A shallow shelf is created for plants: 50% water garden, 50% swimming area. No chlorine, the plants do the work. There are amazing examples on the internet if you look up ""swimming pond"" or ""natural swimming pool.""
A picture is worth a thousand words. This is how they have done it in Ibiza, Spain at Can Marti.
But a dream such as this is not for the public, so says the state in these United States. Only a pool accompanied by a private home can be filtered this way.
Would it be worth it to build a Water Garden to British Natural Swimming Pool Standards? We'll let you decide.

We formed Keeler Early Era Preservation Society (KEEPS) ""To help preserve history and historic sites in Keeler."" For the children, we need to bridge the past and the future that they may know the full spectrum of history. We will work to archive documents and photos for posterity. For the many buildings from that bygone era, let the decisions rest with the individuals who have taken on the responsibility of private property ownership, but we stand ready to assist, if needed.

What We Need & What You Get With $15,000, we can bring the pool property back into community hands. That's the entire purchase price!  We opened escrow with $1,500, the result of our first round of fundraising.  http://igg.me/at/keelerpool

The perks are intrinsic . . . something to warm your heart and give you goose bumps. If we don't reach our goal, we will donate the funds we raised to the Eastern California Museum.    The Impact A natural swimming pool on the edge of the storied Owens Lake will complement the work of many and create another restorative space:  Water is precious. We will take care of the artesian spring as a community. Both cutting edge and old as the hills, working with nature will be applied here.    Risks & Challenges We have a long way to go. Looking at the pool with two feet of dust sitting in the bottom, it is understandable that people are daunted.  We have talked to pool experts, and they say it is technically do-able. One of our biggest challenges will be keeping the characterof the site and enhancing, not disturbing the quietude.

Sharing the vision widely enough that natural support will materialize is our undertaking now.    Other Ways You Can Help Donations are great, but there are other important things, too:  We need to get the word out! Think far and wide. People who love history, railroads, mining, Hollywood, Owens Valley and Owens Lake, and Keeler fans (yes, we know you are out there.) As well, it is a project that combines science (think water quality, horticulture) and  stewardship (think living waters and clean swimming).",1.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column31: >Designed by Architects, Manufactured by Techies
column33: >Friday infuses cutting-edge design, functionality and security in the world’s most advanced Smart Lock. Designed by the worlds, perhaps most distruptive
column34: > architects, Bjarke Ingels Group (BIG IDEAS), who
column35: > are behind Two World Trade Center &
column36: the new Googleplex,
column37: >Friday combines design and technology in one package.
column39: >Complimenting any decor through unobtrusive design
column40: >No tools needed to change battery - just use a plastic card (like credit card)
column42: >We believe a Smart Lock should compliment your home rather than draw attention to a blinking gadget. Long term, we also believe that eco-systems and operating systems will serve as the connection point, negating the need for hubs or dongles, which will make installation significantly better.

column5: >Forget your keys and grant access to anyone, from anywhere, at anytime.
column8: >Get complete peace of mind knowing your house is
column11: >protected by industry-leading security standards

column3: >The Friday Smart Lock is perfect if you are renting out through home rental services  such as Airbnb or Homeaway. Instead of handing out physical keys, you can grant  time definite access via the app, giving you peace of mind of who has access to your home.

column1: steel is an unbeatable choice for a smooth, modern look.  Manufactured via intense heat and pressure, this resistant material is brought about by effort and expertise.

Friday has several brighter metal finishes, but if you’d prefer something darker then Gunmetal is the shell you need. Understated, unobtrusive and effortlessly cool, Gunmetal will look stylish without dominating your door.

column3: >Focused on design and connectivity, Friday is the first Smart Lock to offer both Wi-Fi and Bluetooth out of the box.
>Not at home? Not a problem... Grant access to anyone from anywhere, temporarily or forever. Never waste time waiting around again.

column1: Use the app to grant temporary, one-time access, or permanent access and cancel at anytime. You can also access log files to see activity via your phone.
A keyless future is in the palm of your hand. Ditch your keys and get into your house hassle-free, thanks to Bluetooth or WiFi via your smartphone.

column2: >Friday is serious about security, exceeding industry leading standards by protecting confidentiality of data and device authentication based on AES-CCM cryptography and other standards.

>The Friday Smart Lock easily installs in minutes, showing off its stunning contemporary design on the inside, while avoiding any unwanted attention from the outside. Click HERE to see compatible door locks.

/>

No need for expensive or permanent modifications. Just unscrew your door knob (2 screws) and insert the baseplate allowing you to fasten the Friday Smart Lock. That's it - you have just gone keyless!

>Good looks are one thing, but size is quite another. Friday has the smallest dimensions of any retrofit Smart Lock on the market. Measuring no more than 75mm wide and 47.5mm high (after new update), Friday Smart Lock will not dominate your front door like most other smart locks.

column1: To come up with a design that was both practical and stylish, we sought inspiration from architecture, where aesthetics and functionality work in tandem. The Friday Smart Lock´s design draws from the modern architectural principle of the Saddle Roof, which can be seen on buildings such as New York's W57 and Lincoln Center, as well as Tokyo's St. Mary's Cathedral.

The battery status is monitored by Friday Lock itself, which will notify you via the Friday App when its level reaches a certain threshold. The battery is rechargeable and comes with a charger that plugs into any USB charger.
How does the Friday Smart Lock work?
Friday Smart Lock lets you open your door with your smartphone instead of your traditional key.

By communicating with your phone through Bluetooth, it will detect that you are nearby and allow you to open the door with a single tap.

 

Is The Friday Smart Lock secure?

Friday Smart Lock is very secure. The communication protocol uses 128 bit encryption, which is the same encryption levels as the biggest banks in the world. Please also note that the Friday Lock sits on the inside of your door and therefore won't attract unwanted attention.

 

What do I do if my phone runs out of battery?
Should you run out of power, there are several ways to get through the door:

• Friday Smart Lock fits over the original lock, so the traditional key will still function - meaning that you have a backup option.

 

How much does it cost?

The Friday Smart Lock will cost $249 at retail. However, by participating in the crowdfunding campaign, you can take advantage of our special offers.

 

Why is the price for Scandinavia higher?
The price for our supporters in Scandinavia is higher due to increased shipping costs, and VAT.  The breakdown of the added costs include VAT (25%), Duty (2.7%) and extra shipping costs.

column2:
>In order to ensure that our supporters in Scandinavia do not have any unpleasant surprises from the delivery process we request that you add this amount to your order to cover these costs and we will take care of the rest.

 

Links for VAT for Denmark, Norway, Sweden.  HTS codes for the EU are 8301.40.1100.

 

What kind of doors will friday work with?

column1:
Friday can now support most standard single cylinder deadbolts and Scandinavian deadbolts

 

Where do you ship to?

We ship worldwide, but please check for compatibility if you are outside of the US/Canada and Scandinavia.  Click here to see compatibility list. Alternatively send an email to support@fridaylabs.co with a photo of your lock + door.

 

Where do I get batteries

You can easily order batteries directly through Friday Smart Lock.

 

What if my mains power goes down?

Friday Smart Lock is battery powered so you don’t need mains power for it to work. 

 

Can I open the door manually?

The door can be opened manually by twisting the lock from the inside.  Your standard key will continue to function as well. 

 

Does Friday Smart Lock have mobile apps?

When we launch we will release mobile apps for iOS and Android. More platforms will eventually be supported, but in the meantime you can also use the web dashboard from your phone. 

 

How do I become a distributor of Friday Smart Lock?

Please contact us at sales@fridaylabs.co for further information.  

 

When will Friday Smart Lock be available?

Shipping December 2016. 

 

I have more questions! 

All feedback is more than welcome. If you can’t find your answers in the FAQ, you can email us at support@fridaylabs.co, or write to us on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

column1: ","CNET  |  Engadget | Digital Trends Designed by Architects, Manufactured by Techies Friday infuses cutting-edge design, functionality and security in the world’s most advanced Smart Lock. Designed by the worlds, perhaps most distruptive architects, Bjarke Ingels Group (BIG IDEAS), who are behind Two World Trade Center & the new Googleplex, Friday combines design and technology in one package.   Complimenting any decor through unobtrusive design No tools needed to change battery - just use a plastic card (like credit card) We believe a Smart Lock should compliment your home rather than draw attention to a blinking gadget. Long term, we also believe that eco-systems and operating systems will serve as the connection point, negating the need for hubs or dongles, which will make installation significantly better.
Forget your keys and grant access to anyone, from anywhere, at anytime. Get complete peace of mind knowing your house is protected by industry-leading security standards.

The Friday Smart Lock is perfect if you are renting out through home rental services  such as Airbnb or Homeaway. Instead of handing out physical keys, you can grant  time definite access via the app, giving you peace of mind of who has access to your home.
steel is an unbeatable choice for a smooth, modern look.  Manufactured via intense heat and pressure, this resistant material is brought about by effort and expertise.

Friday has several brighter metal finishes, but if you’d prefer something darker then Gunmetal is the shell you need. Understated, unobtrusive and effortlessly cool, Gunmetal will look stylish without dominating your door.
Mounting, usage & change of battery shown
Focused on design and connectivity, Friday is the first Smart Lock to offer both Wi-Fi and Bluetooth out of the box.
Not at home? Not a problem... Grant access to anyone from anywhere, temporarily or forever. Never waste time waiting around again.
Use the app to grant temporary, one-time access, or permanent access and cancel at anytime. You can also access log files to see activity via your phone.
A keyless future is in the palm of your hand. Ditch your keys and get into your house hassle-free, thanks to Bluetooth or WiFi via your smartphone.
Friday is serious about security, exceeding industry leading standards by protecting confidentiality of data and device authentication based on AES-CCM cryptography and other standards.

The Friday Smart Lock easily installs in minutes, showing off its stunning contemporary design on the inside, while avoiding any unwanted attention from the outside. Click HERE to see compatible door locks.
No need for expensive or permanent modifications. Just unscrew your door knob (2 screws) and insert the baseplate allowing you to fasten the Friday Smart Lock. That's it - you have just gone keyless!

Good looks are one thing, but size is quite another. Friday has the smallest dimensions of any retrofit Smart Lock on the market. Measuring no more than 75mm wide and 47.5mm high (after new update), Friday Smart Lock will not dominate your front door like most other smart locks.

To come up with a design that was both practical and stylish, we sought inspiration from architecture, where aesthetics and functionality work in tandem. The Friday Smart Lock´s design draws from the modern architectural principle of the Saddle Roof, which can be seen on buildings such as New York's W57 and Lincoln Center, as well as Tokyo's St. Mary's Cathedral.

The battery status is monitored by Friday Lock itself, which will notify you via the Friday App when its level reaches a certain threshold. The battery is rechargeable and comes with a charger that plugs into any USB charger.
How does the Friday Smart Lock work?
Friday Smart Lock lets you open your door with your smartphone instead of your traditional key.
By communicating with your phone through Bluetooth, it will detect that you are nearby and allow you to open the door with a single tap. Is The Friday Smart Lock secure?

Friday Smart Lock is very secure. The communication protocol uses 128 bit encryption, which is the same encryption levels as the biggest banks in the world. Please also note that the Friday Lock sits on the inside of your door and therefore won't attract unwanted attention.  What do I do if my phone runs out of battery?
Should you run out of power, there are several ways to get through the door:
Friday Smart Lock fits over the original lock, so the traditional key will still function - meaning that you have a backup option. How much does it cost?
The Friday Smart Lock will cost $249 at retail. However, by participating in the crowdfunding campaign, you can take advantage of our special offers. Why is the price for Scandinavia higher?
The price for our supporters in Scandinavia is higher due to increased shipping costs, and VAT.  The breakdown of the added costs include VAT (25%), Duty (2.7%) and extra shipping costs.

In order to ensure that our supporters in Scandinavia do not have any unpleasant surprises from the delivery process we request that you add this amount to your order to cover these costs and we will take care of the rest. Links for VAT for Denmark, Norway, Sweden.  HTS codes for the EU are 8301.40.1100. What kind of doors will friday work with?
Friday can now support most standard single cylinder deadbolts and Scandinavian deadbolts Where do you ship to?

We ship worldwide, but please check for compatibility if you are outside of the US/Canada and Scandinavia.  Click here to see compatibility list. Alternatively send an email to support@fridaylabs.co with a photo of your lock + door.  Where do I get batteries
You can easily order batteries directly through Friday Smart Lock. What if my mains power goes down?
Friday Smart Lock is battery powered so you don’t need mains power for it to work.  Can I open the door manually?
The door can be opened manually by twisting the lock from the inside.  Your standard key will continue to function as well.  Does Friday Smart Lock have mobile apps?

When we launch we will release mobile apps for iOS and Android. More platforms will eventually be supported, but in the meantime you can also use the web dashboard from your phone.  How do I become a distributor of Friday Smart Lock?
Please contact us at sales@fridaylabs.co for further information.   When will Friday Smart Lock be available?

Shipping December 2016.  I have more questions! All feedback is more than welcome. If you can’t find your answers in the FAQ, you can email us at support@fridaylabs.co, or write to us on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

column2: >The Stalactite 102 is a high definition resin 3D printer designed to meet the most demanding standards, with innovative technology, yet still at an affordable price.
column3:
>WE ARE PROUD TO INTRODUCE THE STALACTITE 102, A HIGH DEFINITION RESIN 3D PRINTER

At Stalactite we are convinced that excellence resides in the details. The excellence we intend to convey through uncompromised industrial and product design. We opted to introduce innovative ideas and key improvements to pre-existing concepts that often did not deliver on what had been initially promised. We are now unveiling our desktop 3D Printer, designed from the ground up by our team of engineers and product designers. Be ready to be amazed!
>Minimum layer thickness down to 25 microns (hardware can support layers as thin as 10 microns).
>High DPI (dot per inch) density on the X/Y plane (100 microns NORMAL mode, 50 microns FINE mode).
>Mechanized aluminum and laser cut steel components.
>Proprietary software with fast slicing and automatic supports.
>Wide choice of printing materials: currently up to 4 different resins with a variety of properties.

>THE 3D PRINTING TECHNOLOGY ALLOWING FOR HIGHEST DETAIL AND QUALITY

Although Laser 3d printers are an interesting solution for certain applications, our know-how in the field led us to develop our devices around the DLP technology, mainly for two leading properties:

column7: > we can reach feature details of 50 microns, which is a six-fold improvement compared to Laser 3d printers that are limited by the geometry of the Laser beam (pointer diameter, varying shape, focus and raster speed).

column3: >Build Times: The Stalactite 102 builds each layer within a constant exposure time, making the size of the object within the X/Y build area independent of the build time. It doesn't matter how many objects you fit within the build area, print times will always remain the same, depending solely on the number of layers in the Z-axis. There's no rastering time, no head or pointer movement process, as is prevalent in the FDM, Inkjet and Laser 3D printing technologies.

column1:
Some examples where you can see the impressive resolution achieved by the Stalactite 102:



A WIDE PALETTE OF MATERIALS

We develop the resins in-house, meaning that we can offer a wide range of materials with different properties. At launch date there will be 4 materials available and several more in the development pipeline. Each material offers different physical properties:
column3: >STANDARD: Our entry level resin. Affordable and suitable for general 3d printing needs, from figurines to maquettes or quick prototypes.
column5: >PROTOTYPING: A hard and thought material, aimed at print objects that require improved physical properties. It has similar properties as ABS or Nylon plastic. Ideal for electronic housings, cogs, Iphone holders... Use this for your engineering and über-nerd projects!
column7: >ELASTIC: A resin with very peculiar properties: It's elastic and flexible!! This opens up a world of options for your prototypes and props!
column9: >WAXY: It demonstrates similar properties to investment casting waxes. Once you print your model you will be able to use the lost wax investment process and cast your designs to bronze, silver, gold or any meltable metal. This resin is particularly well suited for jewelers and miniature figurines manufacturers!!
column11:
/>


A MACHINE DESIGNED TO LAST

We stand behind the quality of our products. We do not concede to programmed obsolescence or marketing smoke-screens. We are passionate designers, and you can see how this shows in our products. We want you to accompany us in this pursuit of distinction. From a beautifully crafted steel chassis, to ZERO_MAX (TM) couplings, to our innovative dual peeling system. This machine is designed to last a lifetime (perhaps even your children will use it down the line
column12:
) ).

Easily switch between Normal and Fine resolution!

SOFTWARE

Following our philosophy, the software is elegant and minimal, allowing to spend less time in cryptic configurations and spend more time printing. Automatic and manual supports are available, with configurable thickness, base size and rod diameter.

Select the material in advance and calculate the cost of each print.


GOALS

We need the contribution from people like you to help us to make this launch a success! Our objective is to provide high quality 3D printers for a demanding public.

column1: • To prepare for production, to engage as soon as our campaign concludes. Status: 80%
• Create Web-store, a Forum with a vibrant community and a knowledge base. Status: 20%

WHO ARE WE:

Stalactite is a Start-Up based in Barcelona, created by a group of young entrepreneurs. We share a clear vision and passion and contribute with a diverse set of skills. Our work is based in the research of new mechanisms, design, material research and ergonomics, applied to high resolution 3d printing.

Team &

Oriol Raventós - Technical designer.

Ferdinand Muñoz - Materials Specialist.

Chris Martin - Marketing.

Andrew Leek - Firmware Specialist.

Steve Hernandez - Software Developer.

Santiago Raventós - Adviser.

With the highly regarded help and good job of Eduard Carulla.


FAQ's

column1: <li>What is the retail price of the Stalactite 102? <span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >The cost in our website will be 2.895€ (plus VAT where applicable). Our Indiegogo supporters are definitely receiving special treatment for believing in what we do!

column1: <li>When will my Stalactite 102 arrive?<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > We are already working hard to plan our supply chain and manufacturing operations to make sure you get your Stalactite 102 as soon as possible. Each pledge has an expected delivery date at which we will start to deliver. Shipping times may vary once the package has left but will be sent by insured courier mail where available. We hope the package will travel for less than a week between pick-up and delivery, along with tracking ID that you will be communicated.

> Shipping prices vary by location and country. It will be easier to handle this step in personalized way. After Indiegogo campaign is over and we are ready to start shipping, we will contact you to require your shipping data and calculate the final shipping costs.

column1: <li>How much does international shipping cost?<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > Shipping for European countries will be calculated for each destination. No extra import taxes are required, as all taxes come included in the price. For non-EU destinations, a custom tax may apply on top of the shipping cost. We do not know exactly what the custom taxes may be, so that you will need to inquire and take care about these yourself, in need be. After our Indiegogo project ends, you will be asked to log into our website and pay the appropriate shipping charges.

column1: <li>How much will the print material (resin) cost?<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > Starting at 80€ our Standard version, Prototype &amp
column3: Flexible version 90€ and Waxy 125€ (plus VAT where applicable).

column1: <li>How does the resin system work?<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > Can you leave the resin in the tray? You will just need to pour the resin in the Stalactite 102 vat, just enough to print your object. 5 or 6 mm of resin in the vat goes a long way. The colored shield will keep light entering the build area and help maintaining the resins fresh. We recommend emptying the vat after a long print and pouring it back into the opaque bottle, for longer shelf life (over 6 months). This will also allow the vat to keep in contact with air, which helps keeping it clean and non-stick.

column1: <li>Can the resin be burn-out, for lost-wax casting?<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > Yes! Our Waxy resin is designed to be used this way.

column1: <li>Does the resin need to be carefully handled? Do you have an MSDS?<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > We have MSDS sheet for all our materials. We have formulated them from the get-go with user safety in mind. We will always strive to make them as user friendly and ecologically sound as possible. Our resins do not contain any solvent or VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds) and are chosen to be as little irritancy as possible. As for handling them while they are in the liquid form, the stage where they are more reactive, we recommend using gloves so that you do not irritate your skin in case it´s specially sensitive, after curing and post-curing, the materials are rather inert, but do not recommend using them for prolonged food storage and handling.

column1: <li>Can you design with the print Software? What operating systems will be supported?<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > The print software does not allow for a design phase. You will need to design the object in one of the many available softwares, such Sketchup, Z-Brush, FreeCad, TinkerCad... Once the object has been designed, you can export it to .STL format and this will be read into our print software, where it can be manipulated to fit the build area. We will try to have our software available in all major platforms, by the moment Windows versions are the priority.

column1: <li>How many parts can I print with 1 Kg of resin? <span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >This depends on what object volume you print. Our software will calculate for each object how much resin you will be using. In our experience, 1Kg of resin will last for many, many prints.

column1: ","The Stalactite 102 is a high definition resin 3D printer designed to meet the most demanding standards, with innovative technology, yet still at an affordable price.WE ARE PROUD TO INTRODUCE THE STALACTITE 102, A HIGH DEFINITION RESIN 3D PRINTERAt Stalactite we are convinced that excellence resides in the details. The excellence we intend to convey through uncompromised industrial and product design. We opted to introduce innovative ideas and key improvements to pre-existing concepts that often did not deliver on what had been initially promised. We are now unveiling our desktop 3D Printer, designed from the ground up by our team of engineers and product designers. Be ready to be amazed!SPECS:
Minimum layer thickness down to 25 microns (hardware can support layers as thin as 10 microns).
High DPI (dot per inch) density on the X/Y plane (100 microns NORMAL mode, 50 microns FINE mode).
Mechanized aluminum and laser cut steel components.
Innovative decoupled dual peeling system (patent pending)
Proprietary software with fast slicing and automatic supports.
Wide choice of printing materials: currently up to 4 different resins with a variety of properties.

THE 3D PRINTING TECHNOLOGY ALLOWING FOR HIGHEST DETAIL AND QUALITYAlthough Laser 3d printers are an interesting solution for certain applications, our know-how in the field led us to develop our devices around the DLP technology, mainly for two leading properties:

Resolution: With DLP (Direct Light Processing) we can reach feature details of 50 microns, which is a six-fold improvement compared to Laser 3d printers that are limited by the geometry of the Laser beam (pointer diameter, varying shape, focus and raster speed).

Build Times: The Stalactite 102 builds each layer within a constant exposure time, making the size of the object within the X/Y build area independent of the build time. It doesn't matter how many objects you fit within the build area, print times will always remain the same, depending solely on the number of layers in the Z-axis. There's no rastering time, no head or pointer movement process, as is prevalent in the FDM, Inkjet and Laser 3D printing technologies.

Some examples where you can see the impressive resolution achieved by the Stalactite 102:A WIDE PALETTE OF MATERIALSWe develop the resins in-house, meaning that we can offer a wide range of materials with different properties. At launch date there will be 4 materials available and several more in the development pipeline. Each material offers different physical properties:STANDARD: Our entry level resin. Affordable and suitable for general 3d printing needs, from figurines to maquettes or quick prototypes.PROTOTYPING: A hard and thought material, aimed at print objects that require improved physical properties. It has similar properties as ABS or Nylon plastic. Ideal for electronic housings, cogs, Iphone holders... Use this for your engineering and über-nerd projects!ELASTIC: A resin with very peculiar properties: It's elastic and flexible!! This opens up a world of options for your prototypes and props!WAXY: It demonstrates similar properties to investment casting waxes. Once you print your model you will be able to use the lost wax investment process and cast your designs to bronze, silver, gold or any meltable metal. This resin is particularly well suited for jewelers and miniature figurines manufacturers!!A MACHINE DESIGNED TO LASTWe stand behind the quality of our products. We do not concede to programmed obsolescence or marketing smoke-screens. We are passionate designers, and you can see how this shows in our products. We want you to accompany us in this pursuit of distinction. From a beautifully crafted steel chassis, to ZERO_MAX (TM) couplings, to our innovative dual peeling system. This machine is designed to last a lifetime (perhaps even your children will use it down the line
column2: ) ).Easily switch between Normal and Fine resolution!SOFTWAREFollowing our philosophy, the software is elegant and minimal, allowing to spend less time in cryptic configurations and spend more time printing. Automatic and manual supports are available, with configurable thickness, base size and rod diameter.Select the material in advance and calculate the cost of each print.GOALSWe need the contribution from people like you to help us to make this launch a success! Our objective is to provide high quality 3D printers for a demanding public.

column1: To prepare for production, to engage as soon as our campaign concludes. Status: 80%
Polish up last design details: Status: 99%
Create Web-store, a Forum with a vibrant community and a knowledge base. Status: 20%

WHO ARE WE:Stalactite is a Start-Up based in Barcelona, created by a group of young entrepreneurs. We share a clear vision and passion and contribute with a diverse set of skills. Our work is based in the research of new mechanisms, design, material research and ergonomics, applied to high resolution 3d printing.Team & Collaborators:Joan Raventós - Founder & Concept designer.Oriol Raventós - Technical designer.Ferdinand Muñoz - Materials Specialist.Chris Martin - Marketing.Andrew Leek - Firmware Specialist.Steve Hernandez - Software Developer.Santiago Raventós - Adviser.With the highly regarded help and good job of Eduard Carulla.FAQ's

What is the retail price of the Stalactite 102? The cost in our website will be 2.895€ (plus VAT where applicable). Our Indiegogo supporters are definitely receiving special treatment for believing in what we do!

When will my Stalactite 102 arrive? We are already working hard to plan our supply chain and manufacturing operations to make sure you get your Stalactite 102 as soon as possible. Each pledge has an expected delivery date at which we will start to deliver. Shipping times may vary once the package has left but will be sent by insured courier mail where available. We hope the package will travel for less than a week between pick-up and delivery, along with tracking ID that you will be communicated.

Why isn´t shipping included? Shipping prices vary by location and country. It will be easier to handle this step in personalized way. After Indiegogo campaign is over and we are ready to start shipping, we will contact you to require your shipping data and calculate the final shipping costs.

How much does international shipping cost? Shipping for European countries will be calculated for each destination. No extra import taxes are required, as all taxes come included in the price. For non-EU destinations, a custom tax may apply on top of the shipping cost. We do not know exactly what the custom taxes may be, so that you will need to inquire and take care about these yourself, in need be. After our Indiegogo project ends, you will be asked to log into our website and pay the appropriate shipping charges.
How much will the print material (resin) cost? Starting at 80€ our Standard version, Prototype & Flexible version 90€ and Waxy 125€ (plus VAT where applicable).

How does the resin system work? Can you leave the resin in the tray? You will just need to pour the resin in the Stalactite 102 vat, just enough to print your object. 5 or 6 mm of resin in the vat goes a long way. The colored shield will keep light entering the build area and help maintaining the resins fresh. We recommend emptying the vat after a long print and pouring it back into the opaque bottle, for longer shelf life (over 6 months). This will also allow the vat to keep in contact with air, which helps keeping it clean and non-stick.
Can the resin be burn-out, for lost-wax casting? Yes! Our Waxy resin is designed to be used this way.

Does the resin need to be carefully handled? Do you have an MSDS? We have MSDS sheet for all our materials. We have formulated them from the get-go with user safety in mind. We will always strive to make them as user friendly and ecologically sound as possible. Our resins do not contain any solvent or VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds) and are chosen to be as little irritancy as possible. As for handling them while they are in the liquid form, the stage where they are more reactive, we recommend using gloves so that you do not irritate your skin in case it´s specially sensitive, after curing and post-curing, the materials are rather inert, but do not recommend using them for prolonged food storage and handling.

Can you design with the print Software? What operating systems will be supported? The print software does not allow for a design phase. You will need to design the object in one of the many available softwares, such Sketchup, Z-Brush, FreeCad, TinkerCad... Once the object has been designed, you can export it to .STL format and this will be read into our print software, where it can be manipulated to fit the build area. We will try to have our software available in all major platforms, by the moment Windows versions are the priority.

How many parts can I print with 1 Kg of resin? This depends on what object volume you print. Our software will calculate for each object how much resin you will be using. In our experience, 1Kg of resin will last for many, many prints.
