At RelaksoHome, we’ve decided to turn to natural materials that have been used for centuries: Bamboo and Linen. While linen, obtained from the flax plant, has been used for clothing for thousands of years, it is only since the early 2000s that bamboo was made viable for clothing, thanks to research and new technologies.
Combined together, these two plants offer invaluable advantages on an environmental perspective. Here are a few highlights:
• Unlike cotton, both plants can grow free of chemicals, fertilizers and pesticides, which helps improve soil and air quality.
• Bamboo and linen use a 1/3 less water than cotton to grow, which increases water supply for other usage.
• Their transformation process uses less energy than other fibers, which decreases the emission of greenhouse gasses.
By using these two materials, we end up with a product of a high ecological value that contributes in reducing soil, water and air pollution.
“Lyocell” is actually a term used to describe the process a natural fibre goes through when transformed from a tree into a fabric.

Unlike other processes, Lyocell specifically designates a closed-loop process that recovers and reuses up to 99% of the water and the organic compound needed, so no water is wasted unnecessarily. And YES: you have just read “organic compound”. That’s because no hazardous chemicals are involved in this process. Indeed, Lyocell is actually one of the MOST sustainable processes that exists.

Our bamboo and linen bed sheets are not only highly breathable, but also antibacterial and hypoallergenic by nature. This means that people suffering from skin problems will see their skin appearance improve. This is not only because your skin will “breathe better”, but because the soft texture of the bed sheets and pillows are naturally soothing to your skin.
The bed sheets are also very hygienic as they do not retain odours and stains can easily be washed away. Your bed sheets will smell well and look nice.
Our Lyocell Bamboo and Linen bed sheets offer a perfect balance:
1. Unlike 100% linen bed sheets, our bed sheets do not wrinkle easily and
2. unlike 100% bamboo bed sheets, they do not look super shiny.
With our blend, you obtain a perfect look with a nice and soft touch. You get all the advantages of both fibres, without the inconveniences!
Are you ready to upgrade your well being in bed?
Our RelaksoHome bed sheets are designed for real life needs and to bring you that extra comfort you need to make your bed the best place ever.
Because your well being is at the top of our priority, our bed sheets offer you:
• Reinforced seams and hems with double stitching to ensure quality and durability.
• An adjustable fitted sheet all over the edge to keep the sheet tight and perfectly adjusted to your mattress when you move.
• An extra long flat sheet that can be placed easily below your mattress so your feet stay in.
• Pillow cases with a flap closure to ensure your pillows stay protected and clean. The flap closure also adds an elegant touch to your bed.
• A duvet cover with visible and delicate buttons closure to ensure the duvet stays in place.
• Natural, modern and minimalist look to bring peace and calmness to your bedroom, ensuring your bed sheets stay forever elegant and age well with time.
Remember: with our bed sheets, you acquire a high quality and long lasting good, which will make you save money over the long term. That’s just another reason to love our bed sheets!
Nowadays, more than 85% of the world’s home textile is produced in the Asia-Pacific region, where working conditions and environmental standards can be questioned.

One of the reasons why we turned to Portugal to manufacture our product is because we wanted to partner with a country that share similar values in terms of labour and environmental standards. This way, we rest assured that workers choose their employment freely and that child labour is out of question.

Another reason why we turned to Portugal to manufacture our product is for their strong tradition and reputation. Indeed, Portugal has been known for centuries for offering the highest and finest quality in the home textile industry.

At the beginning of this project, we visited many facilities and met with skilled workers and professionals who transmitted us their passion and knowledge about their work. Our visits allowed us to bond with people who became passionate about our project and vision. They also invested a lot of their time and efforts to make our project possible. Feeling supported is crucial to ensure the continuity of our project, and we found it with our partner.

And… last but not the least: Portugal is among the top countries in the world committed to increase its renewable energy capacities. In fact, a great portion of the energy used for the manufacturing of our product comes from renewable energy. This is another good eco friendly reason to love our product!
For us, this project is very special and we wanted to spread our joy...

Even if our product is made with the highest sustainable standards, we wanted to do something extra for the planet. For this reason, we've decided to partner with an NGO and plant a tree for each support received.
This way, we help reducing our carbon footprint and contribute to reforest areas of the world that most need it. Because together, we can achieve great things. :-)

Because we are concerned about the future of our planet, our bed sheets will be carefully delivered to you in an elegant and eco-friendly packaging, free of plastic. This way, we make sure your experience is consistent with our values.  :-)
We'll email you a survey after the campaign to get your shipping address, colour and size preferences.
Feel free to ask us if you need help with your size, note that there we will be more sizes available.
Elegant and minimalist, our colours will stay intact wash after wash! Our three launch colours are: WHITE, LIGHT GREY AND AQUA GREEN.
Please note that it is one colour per set. If you choose to buy two sets, then you'll get to choose two different colours (and can mix them at home after!).
At the end of the campaign, you will be able to choose your preferred colour through the survey that will be sent to you.
*Please note the colours may differ from one device to another depending on the calibration of your screen.
Check our FAQ at the top of the page or send us an email at: info@relaksohome.com We're happy to help in English, French and Spanish. :-)

We have already produced various samples of our bed sheets in different colours and sizes and have tested them out. Everything worked perfectly well! Some of our lucky friends and family are already enjoying the benefits of sleeping in our bed sheets.

Production is ready to go! 
Our manufacturing partner in Portugal is only awaiting for us to confirm the number of bed sets to be manufactured according to the colours and sizes. We are confident we will meet our time line, but if certain circumstances beyond our control may occur, we would let you know in advance. We’ll keep open and honest communication with you throughout the whole process so you know where your product is and when it’s going to be delivered to you. Please note that any custom charges outside the European Union will need to be satisfied by the backer.

column3: >SHIPPING NOW! The emberlight socket is a simple plug n' play adaptor that turns any light into a smart light. The device installs in 30 seconds, with no hub required. With the emberlight iOS and Android apps, you can control, program and automate your existing light bulbs from anywhere in the world.

column1: There are a lot of choices when it comes to smart lighting, but they all fall short in one way or another.  emberlight has created a smart lighting platform focused on 3 areas:

Simplicity No hub, no wires, no starter pack. We use a combination of WiFi and Bluetooth LE to make the setup process very simple.  You can setup all of your emberlight Sockets on your WiFi network at the same time in less than a minute.

Security Connected devices are either simple or secure.  It's rare that you can find a product that has both.  We've got experts on our team that have found a way to achieve simplicity at a high level of security.

Uptime Connected devices are either fast/responsive, or they offer remote access to the cloud. We wanted both for emberlight. So we use both WiFi and Bluetooth LE.  When you are near the light, emberlight will detect that and ""fall forward"" to Bluetooth for control directly from your phone (securely).  When you walk away, emberlight will detect that and fall back to WiFi/cloud for access from anywhere in the world.

column4: >
column10: >“Emberlight wants to make it easier and more affordable for you to enjoy the benefits of a connected bulb by offering a product that works with your existing lightbulbs.”

column3: One obvious benefit is that by keeping the bulb separate from the smarts, you won't need to throw out (and replace) that smart hardware just because the bulb breaks or burns out.&quot

The emberlight channel is already live on IFTTT.  With IFTTT, ​you can now connect your emberlight sockets to a long list of internet connected devices and services​ such as Facebook, Amazon Echo, online music stations ​like Spotify, Alarm Systems, and many more, enabling you to integrate, coordinate and automate your life.

column1: Control your lights by voice using Amazon Echo when your hands are full.

We’ve built a team based on diverse expertise, experience, and passion. We want you to share in emberlight's vision to bring simple and versatile smart lighting to every home. We’ve been working on emberlight together for over 2 years now and have already gone through 16 prototypes, 4 manufacturing iterations, cleared UL and FCC certifications, and have just started mass production ramp. We are already shipping product. 

We know competitors exist in the lighting space. Big guys. Ok, let’s rephrase that... REALLY big guys. But that's OK, because we’re taking a different approach. As a startup, we have the ability to build a product from the ground up without legacy bias. We decided that we don’t need to push the mainstream connected LED product like everyone else and can build something more flexible that works for everyone. 


People say ""hardware is hard,"" and it should be left to the big boys. Well, at emberlight we put together a team of Silicon Valley hardware veterans with Silicon Valley software engineers and designers to tackle hard things. We’ve all cut our teeth for the past 10-20 years at top tech firms but now we've come together to change the way all of us interact with our home. Passion, talent, and possibility is heating up with emberlight, and we’d love for you to be a part of it.

column1: Incandescent up to 40W. All dimmable LEDs and CFLs.
Certified for damp environments. Not certified for wet environments. Exterior use only if not in direct contact with weather.
iPhone® 5 or later, iPad® 3 or later, with iOS 8.0 and above. Android™ 4.3 and above with Bluetooth® 4.0 and above.
All communications between applications, devices, and emberlight's cloud servers use SSL to prevent unauthorized snooping. Additional security protocols to prevent local attacks.
Single light, On/Off/Dim, groups, customized presets/moods, timers, 3rd party integrations including IFTTT.

Devices will have an owner account.  For security purposes, all users will be required to create an emberlight account. Once devices have been provisioned to an account, they cannot be transferred unless deleted from account.

emberlight app is built on a RESTful API with a realtime component for sending commands to devices. OAuth mechanism will become available for developers to create applications on the emberlight platform. Stay tuned for the release.

We have cleared certifications for North America and have started our production ramp. Our first batch of products were shipped to early beta backers of our original campaign already. We are now producing units for all of our original campaign backers which will be shipped in February 2016.  If you preorder now, you will get a unit from our second batch in March 2016.
We'd love to hear from you! Feel free to reach out to us at support@emberlight.co for any questions or if you just want to say hi.

SHIPPING NOW! The emberlight socket is a simple plug n' play adaptor that turns any light into a smart light. The device installs in 30 seconds, with no hub required. With the emberlight iOS and Android apps, you can control, program and automate your existing light bulbs from anywhere in the world.
There are a lot of choices when it comes to smart lighting, but they all fall short in one way or another.  emberlight has created a smart lighting platform focused on 3 areas:

Simplicity No hub, no wires, no starter pack. We use a combination of WiFi and Bluetooth LE to make the setup process very simple.  You can setup all of your emberlight Sockets on your WiFi network at the same time in less than a minute.

Security Connected devices are either simple or secure.  It's rare that you can find a product that has both.  We've got experts on our team that have found a way to achieve simplicity at a high level of security.

Uptime Connected devices are either fast/responsive, or they offer remote access to the cloud. We wanted both for emberlight. So we use both WiFi and Bluetooth LE.  When you are near the light, emberlight will detect that and ""fall forward"" to Bluetooth for control directly from your phone (securely).  When you walk away, emberlight will detect that and fall back to WiFi/cloud for access from anywhere in the world.
“Emberlight wants to make it easier and more affordable for you to enjoy the benefits of a connected bulb by offering a product that works with your existing lightbulbs.”
One obvious benefit is that by keeping the bulb separate from the smarts, you won't need to throw out (and replace) that smart hardware just because the bulb breaks or burns out.""

“If you think it would be handy to control your home's lighting through your mobile device but you've still got a box full of ordinary light bulbs in the closet, emberlight bids itself as the solution…”The emberlight channel is already live on IFTTT.  With IFTTT, ​you can now connect your emberlight sockets to a long list of internet connected devices and services​ such as Facebook, Amazon Echo, online music stations ​like Spotify, Alarm Systems, and many more, enabling you to integrate, coordinate and automate your life.
Control your lights by voice using Amazon Echo when your hands are full.
Have your lights turn on automatically when your security alarm is triggered​
Sync your porch lights to turn on automatically at sunset everyday

Big guys. Ok, let’s rephrase that... REALLY big guys. But that's OK, because we’re taking a different approach. As a startup, we have the ability to build a product from the ground up without legacy bias. We decided that we don’t need to push the mainstream connected LED product like everyone else and can build something more flexible that works for everyone. People say ""hardware is hard,"" and it should be left to the big boys. Certified for damp environments. Not certified for wet environments. Exterior use only if not in direct contact with weather.
iPhone® 5 or later, iPad® 3 or later, with iOS 8.0 and above. Android™ 4.3 and above with Bluetooth® 4.0 and above.
All communications between applications, devices, and emberlight's cloud servers use SSL to prevent unauthorized snooping. Additional security protocols to prevent local attacks.
Single light, On/Off/Dim, groups, customized presets/moods, timers, 3rd party integrations including IFTTT.

Devices will have an owner account.  For security purposes, all users will be required to create an emberlight account. Once devices have been provisioned to an account, they cannot be transferred unless deleted from account.

emberlight app is built on a RESTful API with a realtime component for sending commands to devices. OAuth mechanism will become available for developers to create applications on the emberlight platform. Stay tuned for the release.

We have cleared certifications for North America and have started our production ramp. Our first batch of products were shipped to early beta backers of our original campaign already. We are now producing units for all of our original campaign backers which will be shipped in February 2016.  If you preorder now, you will get a unit from our second batch in March 2016.
We'd love to hear from you! Feel free to reach out to us at support@emberlight.co for any questions or if you just want to say hi.",20.0,0,"1 Campaign

""A Portable Lamp like no other, with one charge you can take Lucis anywhere and set the mood with 88 Hours of Full color continuous lighting. Charge your phone with the POWER-BANK and Wireless charging functions’’.

 

 

 

 

Yanko Design-- ""...designed with contemporary styling, the device fits well in most modern homes, serving as a neat table lamp that can be carried around with you and placed anywhere in the house.""

Featured on BuzzFeed's coolest products, -- ""Lucis will let you play with over 16 million colors and help create the perfect mood for any situation. ""

""...designed to fit into any social setting thanks to its fully customizable settings, Lucis is totally touch-activated without any apps or fancy software."" --Digital Trends

""The interface reminds me of an iPod Shuffle - up/down volume controls, forward/backward to skip tracks, and a single play/pause button. Hardcore geeks may scoff at the simplistic design, but technophobes will appreciate not needing a technician to set it up."" --Engineering.com

It's miraculous, enchanting little lamp that gives new dimension to your home. You can literally play with Lucis colors. Lucis is perfect for indoor and for outdoor. --Design Plus Mag

Lucis wireless lighting is a proven concept

Lucis 2.0 Bamboo campaigns.


Lucis can charge any device thanks to the powerbank and wireless charging functions! The all new Lucis 3.0 is equipped with strong RBG full Color LEDS that have a maximum output of 180 up to 250 Lumen (30watt). Packed with an enormous battery capacity Lucis 3.0 will give you all the power you need. Share Light &
column6:
Power with your friends!

Lucis is equipped with special touch sensors that control the brightness and dimming. Touch the sensors and play with light. All Lucis lamps are made from the best Grade materials and built to the highest standards. With a high quality matt plexiglass upper housing and solid aluminum ring Lucis is the ideal portable lamp, all lamps are splash proof so you don’t have to worry about a little rain!

The new line of Lucis 3.0 lamps are based upon the trusted Lucis Wireless Lighting principles. Our prior campaigns have been very successful and we hope to continue this trend with you at our side!

We are also coming back with a brand-new line of designated Lucis™ 3.0 accessories, designed to enhance the portability and flexibility of all Lucis™ products. Stay tuned with the campaign to learn more about the accessories. For now
column7:
we are happy to announce that every order will include 1 x Lucis™ rope accessory that enables you to hang your lamp anywhere. All our accessories are made from the best high grade sustainable Bamboo.

A wireless, touch-activated mood light with built in POWER-BANK and Wireless charging functions. Take the power of LUCIS 3.0 anywhere, in- and outdoors. Set the mood with LUCIS 3.0 and charge all your electronics. Use the touch sensors &
column8:
Twist functions to dim and brighten the light or to cycle through the entirety of the color spectrum. Or, let Lucis™ set the mood for you with one of the automatic light programs. There is a light program for any setting, whether it’s a dinner party or a quiet night at the beach.

Indoor or outdoor
column9: you determine the atmosphere. This Dutch-design LED lamp produces over 16 million colors that can be enjoyed in any setting. With up to 88 hours of lighting time you can use the lamp in any setting. Go where the light leads you, with Lucis

column1: Our company is based in Amsterdam and was founded by Lardy and Simon. Designing and producing beautiful products is our passion. Visit  www.innovativebrands.eu to learn more about our company. Our head of design
column2:
Simon has over ten years of experience designing super sports cars for Spyker Cars and works together with Creative Designer Bob in the Design department.

Lardy has many years of experience working together with high-quality production facilities in multiple markets all over the world and works together with Michel in the sourcing department.

column1:
We have used the past year to find the ultimate shape and functionality for the Lucis™ 3.0 models, after many prototype rounds and tweaks made we believe to have finally made the perfect portable lamp. We also took a trip to China to find the best production partners and source our materials, we met a lot of great contacts there that helped us further improve the current models.

Our production factory produces high-quality products, they specialize in creating electronic devices and also produce components for Dr dre's Beats Headphones.

We are proud to announce that the Lucis™ 3.0 models are Arrow certified, which means that the Arrow certified Engineers verified that the Lucis™ 3.0 models are feasible for production.

Want to learn more about other Lucis wireless lighting products &
column2:
accessories? Visit our website www.lucislamp.com

Risks and challenges - Lucis 3.0 production &
column3: engineering is fully finished so there are no challenges &amp
column4:
risks anymore we are shipping our products worldwide !

Risks

We have taken the following steps to mitigate our risks:

1. Testing: We have been creating, reshaping and perfecting Lucis ever since the idea was born. We have developed lots of prototypes which have all been excessively tested on a number of factors including
column5:
excessive exposure to water, charging time, burning time, lumen output, wireless charging functionality, powerbank functionality and practical usability. Our experience with past projects has taught us what to look for and we were able to further improve the lamps because of this.

2. Reliable sourcing and quality control (QC): Besides our experience with sourcing in China, we have our very own sourcing and QC partner in China. Our partner was born in China and raised in New Zealand and understands both worlds. He has worked in the lighting industry for years. All our products will be inspected according to AQL 2.5/4.0 standards. Our own trip to China last year further improved our production and sourcing process which results in a much better product.

3. Certification: All Lucis™ 3.0 Models are tested and internationally certified
The models comply with: FCC/RohS/CE 

4. Transport: In order to make sure you receive the Lucis™ 3.0 products in mint condition we use protective packaging and exclusively work with the best logistic partners. We have delivered our products throughout the world and know what it takes to do so.

Challenges

So having reduced the risks to a bare minimum, the only challenge remaining is to realize our dreams and ambitions and to make Lucis 2.1 Bamboo an indispensable item in every living room worldwide!

column1: • The Lucis™ 3.0 products are Arrow certified which means they are fully functional.
• Get everyone involved in the Lucis™ ‘’social’’ movement to bring back fun conversations on a dinner night out, while Lucis™ sets the mood and charges your Phone!

We always value good feedback or social media shares from your experiences! Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign!

Thanks for your time!
Best of Regards
Lucis™ team

Hi and welcome to Viralio (Viral I/O as in Input/Output)
My name is Angelos and I've been in the market of web development and internet marketing since the .com BOOM.

A few years ago I've teamed up with a group of another 5 highly specialized programmers and IT professionals and we've been cooking software and websites ever since. Projects like BeepXtra and others gave us the challenges we needed to expand our reach and knowledge.
The problem is, there is too much to handle in the technology field. We know it from experiences we've had with clients, and I am sure you see it too.
Having a website today is almost mandatory. But is that enough?

You don't just need a freebie website to succeed. You need a professionally designed and managed website, that is both functional and responsive in the various internet enabled devices that people use today. PCs, laptops, tablets, smartphones... Then there's browsers, then there is compatibility, screen resolutions, speed performance, hosting.... POUF !!!
STOP THERE... That's way too much to handle for a business man, and IT Companies charge thousands to cover all of the above aspects (note: IF they are capable !!! )

Even if you already have and love your website, you probably need to see what else Viralio is capable of!!! Viralio can integrate with your existing site, and increase your online presence. Read further for more info!!!
Say you made it... got a brilliant website for the world to see... So now what?
You need to promote it, social media pages like Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin... and who is going to keep all these updated? You? Or the IT Companies you pay thousands to do it for you?
A simple interface to make it happen. A Wizard style, step by step, that would quickly gather the information and create a professional website for your business.
It will also create social media pages and implement it onto your website.
The necessary Location map of your premises is also a must have feature.
And let's not stay there. Raise the bar of your expectations a bit more.
Keeping it all Up2Date is what makes the difference. It's what makes a website successful. Keeps visitors coming back for more, and attracts even more.
""A Programmer is a machine, that converts caffeine into code"" Unknown Wise Man (Or woman!!!)

We need at least another 3 specialist programmers. We need coffee supplies, loads of them, to keep focused. We need funding for our office, electricity to power our high-spec twin/triple monitor workstations. We need inspiration!!!
We want to bring this to life. We want YOU to have the pleasure of creating a professional online presence yourself, with NO IT skills, no programming, no complex tasks.
• A comprehensive selection of professional customizable designs to choose from.
• Automated Social Media Creation Service (Where applicable. Some maybe semi-automated).
• Addon widgets, such as currency converters, event calendar, weather module etc.
• AI (Artificial Intelligence) Analysis and Advice on how to best customize your website for more sales conversions**

column2: >AI (Artificial Intelligence) Analysis and Advice on how to best customize your website for more sales conversions**

column1: *Viralio will send you a reminder at an interval that you choose (Weekly, bi-weekly, monthly etc) with a few questions such as ""Got a new big client?"", ""Had a party or event?"", ""Got a special offer this week?"" etc, and will update your social media automatically with the replies you provide. It's as easy as answering to an email with an attachment on it.
**The AI Manager will analyse user behaviour and provide advice on what to look after. Some times, changing a color, or moving a box from left to right, can make a significant impact.

***SEO Manager will provide you with the tools necessary to analyse, optimize, and submit your new website to search engines, directories and specialized websites, in order to rank high in search results and get the traffic you deserve.
We've been involved in the market for many years and experience has shown us that keeping up with technology is not an easy  task.

We've developed large scale projects, handled big data management, used complex algorithms and new technologies and we feel confident that this project will be a success and open a new ERA in the field of web development.
We feel confident, that we will solve the problem of the small to medium businesses competing with giants for a piece of the pie online.

Even if you don't fund our campaign, simply by signing up for a free account and inviting a couple friends might go a long way and even earn you some commission. We have members who are doing this full time and earning a substantial income
• So help us by getting the word out and make some noise about Viralio.
• Share this campaign with your friends and relatives! You might be doing them a HUGE favour!

Thank you for visiting our campaign and we hope to see you onboard soon.

column11:
>

We're the EZ team, from Italy, and we've designed the EZBoard so that you can easily make connected home devices that can interact with other connected hardware around your home through Lelylan's platform.

What can you make? Light, thermostat and sprinkler control to give you an idea, but the possibilities are limitless! Contribute now and start taking control of your home.
column14: >EZcontrol.IT is proudly part of the official Arduino™ AtHeart program.
column15:
>

EZcontrol.IT is also made in Italy and quality is our main goal.


The Hardware
column16: >EZboard is a low power consumption Arduino™ compatible board, equipped with an onboard WiFi controller, microSD card socket, temperature sensor, and power relay.
column17: >The board was designed to run for long periods of time powered by batteries, as low as 3.7V (common value for a LiPo pack) and it integrates all the hardware necessary to implement most of the common applications for Home Automation.
column18: >Light control, Thermostat, Temperature logging, Sprinkler control, are all application that can be implemented without the use of any external components. All with the simplicity of any other Arduino™ compatible board.
column19:
>EZboard comes with the libraries, the code, and even the basic program already installed, so you don't need to do anything else other then open the box, plug it in, and start to control anything you want!


The Software
column20:
>While hardware has been affordable and accessible for a long time, the software platform is the real hurdle, when implementing an efficient and affordable Connected Home.

Lelylan is the solution.
column21: >This is a very easy to use Home Automation cloud platform, universally compatible with any device capable of being connected to the web, that allows you to connect and control the EZboard, and any other device based on Arduino™, Raspberry PI™, Electric imp™, mBed™, Flyport™, Nanode™ and many more.
column22: >Lelylan is based on the MQTT protocol (MQ Telemetry Transport), the same used by Facebook to send live updates to the mobile messaging applications, and offers a simple API that can be used to program basically any platform. The front end is totally editable as well, and the API for the user interface is available for Curl, Ruby, Node.js, Angular JS and Python.
column23: >Because a standard user interface is already available, you don't need to be a developer to use and enjoy Lelylan. Plus, the ready to use interface is based on AngularJS, HTML5 and CSS3, so you can use it on any mobile device without installing any app.
column24:
>The advantage for anyone who is not familiar with software development is that Lelylan comes with a fully implemented universal user interface, so you can connect and control your devices without knowing how to write a single line of code!


The Match
column25: >EZboard was designed after Lelylan, so it's specifically optimized to interact with the control platform. While the two projects are independent, with the hardware and the software designed by different groups, the advantage of EZcontrol.IT is the integration of the two.
column26: >You will get both the Hardware and the Software, together working as a perfect Match.
column27: >This is the real deal! Lelylan can be used with any piece of hardware, including the one you already have, and EZboard is a fully Arduino™ compatible, low power consumption, development platform. Together the two are a plug&amp
column28: play, easy to implement, and extremely affordable platform for the Internet of Things.
column29:
>The perks for this campaign includes both the Hardware and the lifetime long subscription to the Software platform, that can be used with any device, not only ours, for basically half the cost of the two separated!

The Basic Match - to start controlling things at only $45 (or less if you act fast)

1 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan platform for 1 device

The Makers Match - with two devices to control and interact at only $79 (or less if you act fast)

2 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan platform for 2 devices
column31:
> - to give a HAL 9000 power to your place at only $179

5 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan platform for 5 devices
column33:
> - takes you to the next level with ten boards and Lelylan Premium (unlimited)

10 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan premium platform for unlimited devices
column34:
>You can choose your Perk right now, on the right side of this page, and start to dream about your very own Connected Home.

Or keep reading to get even more information :-)


About the Hardware
column35: >THIS IS THE ALL NEW WiFi EDITION OF THE EZboard!!!
column36: >EZboard was designed to be, as much as possible, compatible with Arduino™, but at the same time capable of offering more functions and lower power consumption.
column41: >The result is a development board that is only 9mm (0.35"") longer than an original Arduino™ UNO, adopting the same footprint but offering additional functions.
column42: >Compared to an Arduino™ UNO, the EZboard offers: full Internet capability over WiFi (new), microSD card reader, a relay rated 5 Ampere (new), and a TMP36 temperature sensor.
column44: >Everything on the EZboard has been designed to minimize power consumption. For this reason the microcontroller Atmel ATMEGA328P is configured to work a 3.3V and 8MHz of speed. While this could sound like a limit, we have verified that it is more than enough for Home Automation applications.
column45: >The EZboard is a wireless device based on WiFi connectivity! This thanks to the adoption of the CC3000 WiFi adapter from Texas Instruments:
column47: >We have designed the EZboard to be ready for any kind of hack, including advanced programming of the WiFi module. The design of the EZboard allows to update the firmware of the TI CC3000 module without use any additional device!
column48: >The power source could be the USB adapter supplied with the board, but the EZboard was designed to receive power mostly by batteries, the EZboard has a dedicated input that uses 0.1"" pitch connectors like the common JST or even direct soldering of a battery pack to the board.
column53: >The whole board is running at 3.3V, but is 5V tolerant and the use of shields designed for Arduino™ will work at 5V without damaging the board (only the SPI is not compatible with 5V).
column58: >The power circuit is designed to be, as much as possible, efficient while working with batteries and we have dedicated particular efforts in the research of solutions to lower the power consumption.
column59:
>

The USB interface is based on the widely used FT232RL converter from FTDI, that offers drivers and compatibility for every computing platform. This device is separated from the board and we provide it in form of USB adapter. This means that when the EZboard is not connected to a computer and is not sending or receiving communications on the USB, the adapter is not necessary and will save energy.
column63: >The temperature sensor and the onboard relay allows to develop advanced projects, like a connected thermostat, without requiring any additional components, but a battery pack. Why spend so much for a Nest™?!?
column64: >Also you can see that in order to reduce interference and to protect the low voltage circuits, the area related to the relay, that could be connected to high voltage, is physically isolated trough a cut in the PCB from the rest of the board.
column65:
>The temperature sensor, a very common and well supported TMP36, is located as far as possible from the power regulator and from any device that could heat up during normal working conditions, this is to avoid false readings of the actual temperature, due to the proximity of warm components.

Technical specifications:

column2: >Digital I/O Pins: 14 (of which 7 used by the board exclusively)
>Analog Input Pins: 6 (of which 1 used by the board exclusively)
>Flash Memory: 32 KB - SRAM: 2 KB, - EEPROM: 1 KB
>USB Controller: FTDI FT232RL (on external USB cable provided)

column1: The Arduino™ AtHeart program is designed for makers and companies wishing to make their products easily recognisable as based on the Arduino™ technology.
column2:
>
EZboard is a licensed product. This means that part of your contribute will be received directly by Arduino™ to support the development of the IDE.
column3:
>
We are extremely proud to present the first project ever published on Indiegogo officially licensed by Arduino™!


About the Software
column4: >Lelylan is a simple and open API to build the Connected Home where makers can focus on the hardware and on the design process, while developers create new apps for the web, the mobile, and much more.
column5:
>Any request sent to the Lelylan API is forwarded to the physical device, which is in charge of applying the desired changes and of sending back a message to Lelylan when those changes are made.

Lelylan is based on three resources:

Devices
column6:
>A Device is a resource virtually representing everything you interact with everyday of your life. You interact with lights, appliances, alarms, cooling and heating systems, gas sensors, rolling shutters, windows, irrigation, video surveillance, gates, multimedia (audio and video), and much more. With a Device you can simulate, monitor, and control any of those devices through a unique URl.

Physicals
column7:
>If Devices are a virtual representation, Physicals are the real objects you interact with, everyday of your life. To enable the communication between Lelylan and the physical world, the physical device must be able to connect to the Internet and to implement the Physical API.

Types
column8: >A Type describes the structure of a device. Lelylan has started to define the most used ones, but anyone, can create new ones. In its simplest form, every Type can be defined as the combination of three key elements.

column2: >Statuses - what a device is in a specific time of its life.

column1:
It works in 3 easy steps:

The dashboard
column2: >A Dashboard developed with AngularJS to create, control, and monitor all of your <span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column3: >devices with realtime notifications when one of your devices changes its status
column4:
>.

The dashboard is the solution for you to create and control all of your devices, without writing any software.

And the dashboard is available on any device, including smartphones and tablets from any manufacturer. It's not necessary to install any app!

Know more about the dashboard: http://manage.lelylan.com/learn

You can also give Lelylan a try, following this link: http://try.lelylan.com
column5: >You will receive a lifetime subscription from Lelylan, together with your EZboard. Also the board will come pre-loaded with software that allows you to immediately plug it in and start to control things.
column6:
>The subscription you will receive is the Makers plan from Lelylan, valued at $29US. If you request a perk that includes more than one EZboard, then you will also receive the support for the additional devices, valued at $10US each.


Who we are
column7: >We are a group of engineers and software developers from the North East of Italy, not far from Venice to give you a point of reference. Lelylan was developed since 2010 by a group of programmers as an open platform for an easier and accessible Connected Home. We met in a maker space and started to share ideas, that became in time what you are seeing now.
column8:
>We have designed and tested the EZboard for several months, messing around in the house and playing with different solutions, starting from the breadboard until we got to the final design that you can enjoy today.


What we want to do
column9: >The EZboard is well tuned and tested now, while the Lelylan platform has been in final beta for over half a year.
column10:
>It's time to take it to the next level. This means offering users around the world access to the cloud platform, together with the easy to use and affordable hardware.


Why Indiegogo
column11: >To make it affordable we need to produce a first run of minimum 500 EZboards. This is the only way to reduce the costs.
column12: >Everything is ready and we have signed already the manufacturing agreement with an Italian company that works for some of the largest brands in our country, like Olivetti and Telecom Italia group: Erregi Elettronica S.r.l.
column13: >With this campaign on Indiegogo you can have the opportunity to be the first to benefit from this perfect match of Hardware and Software, at an incredible discounted price!
column14:
>The retail price of the EZboard, after the campaign, will not be lower than US$40, while the price for the Lelylan platform is already set at US$29. So in the future this match will cost at least US$69, but during this Indiegogo campaign you can pay much less, saving up to 50% if you act fast and catch an Early Bird offer.


Fulfillment

How long it will take
column15: >We decided to set the shipping time a bit far in the future, four months after the end of this campaign. This is because we won't take the risk of disappointing you. The CPU used for the EZboard is the same one used on the Arduino™ UNO SMD, or other compatible devices like the RedBoard™ from Sparkfun™: Atmel's ATMEGA328P. While this CPU is often available, for a few hundreds of thousands of pieces, from the common distributors like Digikey or Mouser, in case of missing stock the usual lead time is 6-12 weeks. This means that if the CPU will be out of stock at the time this campaign ends, when it is time for us to order the parts, then we could wait up to three months.
column16: >It's unlikely and we believe we will be able to ship in advance, but we must be real and take into account any risk of delay.
column17: >We don't want to promise a fast turn and then send you a message announcing delays, after the end of the campaign. We believe in a serious approach and so we want to make clear that this is the longest time you could wait.
column18: >We have already selected the manufacturer. The production will be Made in Italy. We also don't know how many boards we will need to produce, at the end, and we will need to test and program all, one by one, so it's better to choose a safe shipping date, and be sure to be able to keep the promise.
column19:
>We think it will take less time and we could ship in advance, but we can't guarantee it.


Shipment is quite expensive
column20: >We will produce and ship from Italy. Postage is expensive here :-(
column21: >We could choose to produce in Asia and ship from there, at a fraction of the cost. But we wanted to offer something different and have full control of all aspects of the fulfillment.
column22: >We hope you will understand that a few more dollars of cost are due to the quality and nothing else.
column23: >Because we can't predict the location where we will need to ship, we haven't included the shipping costs in the value of the perks. Please don't forget to add the amount to cover the shipping costs to the total of your contribution. This is equal to US$10 for shipments to Italy and US$16 for the rest of the world.
column24: >Thanks for your contribution to our project and welcome to a Better Connected World!
column25: >Disclaimer: Trademarked names, logos, and images may appear in this page. column1:
Additional detailed pictures of the EZboard:








","We're the EZ team, from Italy, and we've designed the EZBoard so that you can easily make connected home devices that can interact with other connected hardware around your home through Lelylan's platform.What can you make? Light, thermostat and sprinkler control to give you an idea, but the possibilities are limitless! Contribute now and start taking control of your home.NEW! NOW WIRELESS!!!EZcontrol.IT is proudly part of the official Arduino™ AtHeart program.EZcontrol.IT is also made in Italy and quality is our main goal.The HardwareEZboard is a low power consumption Arduino™ compatible board, equipped with an onboard WiFi controller, microSD card socket, temperature sensor, and power relay.The board was designed to run for long periods of time powered by batteries, as low as 3.7V (common value for a LiPo pack) and it integrates all the hardware necessary to implement most of the common applications for Home Automation.Light control, Thermostat, Temperature logging, Sprinkler control, are all application that can be implemented without the use of any external components. All with the simplicity of any other Arduino™ compatible board.EZboard comes with the libraries, the code, and even the basic program already installed, so you don't need to do anything else other then open the box, plug it in, and start to control anything you want!The SoftwareWhile hardware has been affordable and accessible for a long time, the software platform is the real hurdle, when implementing an efficient and affordable Connected Home.Lelylan is the solution.This is a very easy to use Home Automation cloud platform, universally compatible with any device capable of being connected to the web, that allows you to connect and control the EZboard, and any other device based on Arduino™, Raspberry PI™, Electric imp™, mBed™, Flyport™, Nanode™ and many more.Lelylan is based on the MQTT protocol (MQ Telemetry Transport), the same used by Facebook to send live updates to the mobile messaging applications, and offers a simple API that can be used to program basically any platform. The front end is totally editable as well, and the API for the user interface is available for Curl, Ruby, Node.js, Angular JS and Python.Because a standard user interface is already available, you don't need to be a developer to use and enjoy Lelylan. Plus, the ready to use interface is based on AngularJS, HTML5 and CSS3, so you can use it on any mobile device without installing any app.The advantage for anyone who is not familiar with software development is that Lelylan comes with a fully implemented universal user interface, so you can connect and control your devices without knowing how to write a single line of code!The MatchEZboard was designed after Lelylan, so it's specifically optimized to interact with the control platform. While the two projects are independent, with the hardware and the software designed by different groups, the advantage of EZcontrol.IT is the integration of the two.You will get both the Hardware and the Software, together working as a perfect Match.This is the real deal! Lelylan can be used with any piece of hardware, including the one you already have, and EZboard is a fully Arduino™ compatible, low power consumption, development platform. Together the two are a plug&play, easy to implement, and extremely affordable platform for the Internet of Things.The perks for this campaign includes both the Hardware and the lifetime long subscription to the Software platform, that can be used with any device, not only ours, for basically half the cost of the two separated!The Basic Match - to start controlling things at only $45 (or less if you act fast)1 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan platform for 1 deviceThe Makers Match - with two devices to control and interact at only $79 (or less if you act fast)2 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan platform for 2 devicesThe Space Odyssey Match - to give a HAL 9000 power to your place at only $1795 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan platform for 5 devicesThe Business Match - takes you to the next level with ten boards and Lelylan Premium (unlimited)10 EZboard WiFi + Lifetime Lelylan premium platform for unlimited devicesYou can choose your Perk right now, on the right side of this page, and start to dream about your very own Connected Home.Or keep reading to get even more information :-)About the HardwareTHIS IS THE ALL NEW WiFi EDITION OF THE EZboard!!!EZboard was designed to be, as much as possible, compatible with Arduino™, but at the same time capable of offering more functions and lower power consumption.The result is a development board that is only 9mm (0.35"") longer than an original Arduino™ UNO, adopting the same footprint but offering additional functions.Compared to an Arduino™ UNO, the EZboard offers: full Internet capability over WiFi (new), microSD card reader, a relay rated 5 Ampere (new), and a TMP36 temperature sensor.Everything on the EZboard has been designed to minimize power consumption. For this reason the microcontroller Atmel ATMEGA328P is configured to work a 3.3V and 8MHz of speed. While this could sound like a limit, we have verified that it is more than enough for Home Automation applications.The EZboard is a wireless device based on WiFi connectivity! This thanks to the adoption of the CC3000 WiFi adapter from Texas Instruments:We have designed the EZboard to be ready for any kind of hack, including advanced programming of the WiFi module. The design of the EZboard allows to update the firmware of the TI CC3000 module without use any additional device!The power source could be the USB adapter supplied with the board, but the EZboard was designed to receive power mostly by batteries, the EZboard has a dedicated input that uses 0.1"" pitch connectors like the common JST or even direct soldering of a battery pack to the board.The whole board is running at 3.3V, but is 5V tolerant and the use of shields designed for Arduino™ will work at 5V without damaging the board (only the SPI is not compatible with 5V).The power circuit is designed to be, as much as possible, efficient while working with batteries and we have dedicated particular efforts in the research of solutions to lower the power consumption.The USB interface is based on the widely used FT232RL converter from FTDI, that offers drivers and compatibility for every computing platform. This device is separated from the board and we provide it in form of USB adapter. This means that when the EZboard is not connected to a computer and is not sending or receiving communications on the USB, the adapter is not necessary and will save energy.The temperature sensor and the onboard relay allows to develop advanced projects, like a connected thermostat, without requiring any additional components, but a battery pack. Why spend so much for a Nest™?!?Also you can see that in order to reduce interference and to protect the low voltage circuits, the area related to the relay, that could be connected to high voltage, is physically isolated trough a cut in the PCB from the rest of the board.The temperature sensor, a very common and well supported TMP36, is located as far as possible from the power regulator and from any device that could heat up during normal working conditions, this is to avoid false readings of the actual temperature, due to the proximity of warm components.Technical specifications:
Digital I/O Pins: 14 (of which 7 used by the board exclusively)
Analog Input Pins: 6 (of which 1 used by the board exclusively)
Flash Memory: 32 KB - SRAM: 2 KB, - EEPROM: 1 KB
USB Controller: FTDI FT232RL (on external USB cable provided)
Footprint: compatible with Arduino™ UNO R3

The Arduino™ AtHeart program is designed for makers and companies wishing to make their products easily recognisable as based on the Arduino™ technology.EZboard is a licensed product. This means that part of your contribute will be received directly by Arduino™ to support the development of the IDE.We are extremely proud to present the first project ever published on Indiegogo officially licensed by Arduino™!About the SoftwareLelylan is a simple and open API to build the Connected Home where makers can focus on the hardware and on the design process, while developers create new apps for the web, the mobile, and much more.Any request sent to the Lelylan API is forwarded to the physical device, which is in charge of applying the desired changes and of sending back a message to Lelylan when those changes are made.Lelylan is based on three resources:DevicesA Device is a resource virtually representing everything you interact with everyday of your life. You interact with lights, appliances, alarms, cooling and heating systems, gas sensors, rolling shutters, windows, irrigation, video surveillance, gates, multimedia (audio and video), and much more. With a Device you can simulate, monitor, and control any of those devices through a unique URl.PhysicalsIf Devices are a virtual representation, Physicals are the real objects you interact with, everyday of your life. To enable the communication between Lelylan and the physical world, the physical device must be able to connect to the Internet and to implement the Physical API.TypesA Type describes the structure of a device. Lelylan has started to define the most used ones, but anyone, can create new ones. In its simplest form, every Type can be defined as the combination of three key elements.
Functions - what a device can do.
Statuses - what a device is in a specific time of its life.

It works in 3 easy steps:The dashboardA Dashboard developed with AngularJS to create, control, and monitor all of your devices with realtime notifications when one of your devices changes its status.The dashboard is the solution for you to create and control all of your devices, without writing any software.And the dashboard is available on any device, including smartphones and tablets from any manufacturer. It's not necessary to install any app!Know more about the dashboard: http://manage.lelylan.com/learnYou can also give Lelylan a try, following this link: http://try.lelylan.comYou will receive a lifetime subscription from Lelylan, together with your EZboard. Also the board will come pre-loaded with software that allows you to immediately plug it in and start to control things.The subscription you will receive is the Makers plan from Lelylan, valued at $29US. If you request a perk that includes more than one EZboard, then you will also receive the support for the additional devices, valued at $10US each.Who we areWe are a group of engineers and software developers from the North East of Italy, not far from Venice to give you a point of reference. Lelylan was developed since 2010 by a group of programmers as an open platform for an easier and accessible Connected Home. We met in a maker space and started to share ideas, that became in time what you are seeing now.We have designed and tested the EZboard for several months, messing around in the house and playing with different solutions, starting from the breadboard until we got to the final design that you can enjoy today.What we want to doThe EZboard is well tuned and tested now, while the Lelylan platform has been in final beta for over half a year.It's time to take it to the next level. This means offering users around the world access to the cloud platform, together with the easy to use and affordable hardware.Why IndiegogoTo make it affordable we need to produce a first run of minimum 500 EZboards. This is the only way to reduce the costs.Everything is ready and we have signed already the manufacturing agreement with an Italian company that works for some of the largest brands in our country, like Olivetti and Telecom Italia group: Erregi Elettronica S.r.l.With this campaign on Indiegogo you can have the opportunity to be the first to benefit from this perfect match of Hardware and Software, at an incredible discounted price!The retail price of the EZboard, after the campaign, will not be lower than US$40, while the price for the Lelylan platform is already set at US$29. So in the future this match will cost at least US$69, but during this Indiegogo campaign you can pay much less, saving up to 50% if you act fast and catch an Early Bird offer.FulfillmentHow long it will takeWe decided to set the shipping time a bit far in the future, four months after the end of this campaign. This is because we won't take the risk of disappointing you. The CPU used for the EZboard is the same one used on the Arduino™ UNO SMD, or other compatible devices like the RedBoard™ from Sparkfun™: Atmel's ATMEGA328P. While this CPU is often available, for a few hundreds of thousands of pieces, from the common distributors like Digikey or Mouser, in case of missing stock the usual lead time is 6-12 weeks. This means that if the CPU will be out of stock at the time this campaign ends, when it is time for us to order the parts, then we could wait up to three months.It's unlikely and we believe we will be able to ship in advance, but we must be real and take into account any risk of delay.We don't want to promise a fast turn and then send you a message announcing delays, after the end of the campaign. We believe in a serious approach and so we want to make clear that this is the longest time you could wait.We have already selected the manufacturer. The production will be Made in Italy. We also don't know how many boards we will need to produce, at the end, and we will need to test and program all, one by one, so it's better to choose a safe shipping date, and be sure to be able to keep the promise.We think it will take less time and we could ship in advance, but we can't guarantee it.Shipment is quite expensiveWe will produce and ship from Italy. Postage is expensive here :-(We could choose to produce in Asia and ship from there, at a fraction of the cost. But we wanted to offer something different and have full control of all aspects of the fulfillment.We hope you will understand that a few more dollars of cost are due to the quality and nothing else.Because we can't predict the location where we will need to ship, we haven't included the shipping costs in the value of the perks. Please don't forget to add the amount to cover the shipping costs to the total of your contribution. This is equal to US$10 for shipments to Italy and US$16 for the rest of the world.Thanks for your contribution to our project and welcome to a Better Connected World!Disclaimer: Trademarked names, logos, and images may appear in this page. WE'RE HARD AT WORK FOR YOU

At Baltimore Brew, we’ve been working hard every day (and often long into the night) to bring you the deep reporting and sharp analysis that you know you won’t find anywhere else.

We’ve been at City Hall and on city streets (or knee-deep in convoluted documents) asking tough questions and holding government accountable.

Since 2009, we’ve written more than 3,000 stories, been your eyes and ears at meetings where the city spends millions in a matter of minutes and journeyed to communities from Howard Park to Morrell Park where citizens say they have been feeling left out of the conversation.

WE'VE SAVED YOU MILLIONS

We’ve saved Baltimore millions - by one account more than $100 million -  by spotlighting fishy contracts and questionable spending. We've profiled the unsung heroes making their neighborhoods safer and more livable. We've become a platform for diverse community voices and ideas.

We’ve also grown to 50,000 unique readers a month and recently added a great new neighborhood reporter.

WE CAN'T DO IT ALONE

What we haven’t had much time to do is ask for your help. All this work takes resources, and we can’t do it without you. So support the Brew and become a member today.

Help us reach our goal of raising $20,000 by the end of the year. Your support will ensure we can keep shining a light, finding the devil in the details, and getting citizens the information they need.
column3: >BECOME A MEMBER! SUPPORT THE BREW TODAY! - TAX FREE!

column1: Oh, and did we mention your membership contribution is 100-percent tax-deductible thanks to our fiscal sponsor, Fusion Partnerships? So why are you still reading this? What are you waiting for? Go ahead and become a member of the Baltimore Brew!

What do you think it would smell like to travel in time with an alien? Or to take a train to a school for magic? Perhaps you've wondered what scents you'd discover treking across the cosmos. We've wondered, too. So, we decided we'd take a trip... with our noses. The Zainey Laney Wax subscription box will deliver to you, every month, a brand new adventure for your olfactory senses. Themed off of a geeky subject, we plan to show you the smells of a plethora of different universes. In addition, we'll be giving you a specially made postcard so you can remember your journey!

Our wax melts are made with soy wax, and have no dyes. This means that they will be clean burning, which is better for allergies and the environment. Since each clamshell includes six wax pieces, you can tantalize your olfactory sense longer than a Doctor has lives.
In each box you will also receive:
-Limited edition art created just for the box's theme.
- The ability to vote for your favorite scents to be sold in the store
- Free digital download of art after voting
- Collectible Coin / Rewards program for each box or purchase you make!

In each subscription box will be included five different scents, referring to an aspect, item, or character in the theme. While each clamshell displays original designs, included exclusively is a travel postcard, featuring art based on the theme's universe. On the back of the postcard will be a link to a survey. This not only will help us refine the product, but will let us know what products you like best. Those will be made available later in our online store. Complete the survey, and you can download the postcard's artwork as a digital wallpaper.

Each box will also include a special token.You can also collect tokens from future shop purchases and if you collect ten of them, you can trade it in for a free wax melt from the store! In addition, one lucky winner will receive the Golden Moose token, worth a free wax melt all by itself!

So, what are we going to be doing with this $1,100, you ask? Well, to be honest, not all of it is for us. Almost half of this is going right back to you! All of our perks will be paid for by the campaign itself, and since we will be handling the shipping for you, about $500 of what we raise will be devoted to sending you the wax melts you've been looking for. Other than approximately $94 in fees (depending on how things go), the rest will go towards building up our online wax melt shop, where everyone can purchase these amazing scents.

So, thank you for your interest in this waxy, melty, geeky, smelly goodness. We hope you'll join us in our journey through the sights and smells of everyone's favorite nerd themes! Until then, Stay Zainey.

column2: >Multi-award-winning cutting tool Nimble lets you say goodbye to wasted time with a swipe of your finger.
column3:
>Nimble is quicker and safer than knives and scissors!

 

Nimble Can Be Used Many Different Ways

column1: • Open plastic packets of food in the kitchen.
• Open shrink wrapped, cellophane wrapped and other plastic packed items from around the house.

column2:
>Opening packaging with Nimble is quick and intuitive

 

 

 

 

How to use Nimble

 

 

1. Place on your fingertip with Nimble's head pointing down.

2. Hold item to be cut in your other hand or rest it on a Nimble Cutting Mat.

3. Apply pressure and draw a line to make a cut, with your finger at a 45° angle.

You should be able to cut through a few sheets of standard printing paper and most thin plastics, such as those used for packaging in kitchen and home items.

 

Nimble's Blade is Safer on Skin

Nimble was originally designed for elderly people with hand dexterity problems, so that they could get into packaged food items such as crisps, pasta, rice, and bacon, which have pesky heat-sealed plastics that are not so easy to tear.

Through user-testing with a wide age range, disabled and non-disabled users, we came across the inclusive design aspects of Nimble and realised that it has use for all types of people - making it easy for anyone to open annoying packaging!
column3:
>It's safe!

Nimble is a great alternative to knives and scissors, as it's a much safer option. On thicker, softer skin, Nimble's blade is small enough for the skin to bend around the blade, but on tighter and more frail skin you will likely cause small injury when pressing hard*.

* Disclaimer: We suggest that you do not apply Nimble directly or indirectly to skin. Although Nimble is safer than most knives and scissors we wouldn't recommend that you actively try to hurt yourself to test Nimble's safety.
column5:
/>

Nimble has been getting quite of lot of attention in the press... it has won and been a finalist in several national competitions too!
column7:
>Word is spreading fast... Nimble has won multiple national awards and featured in the international press too!

 

 

Interested in writing about us? Please feel free to email at indiegogo@version22.com or leave a message here on Indiegogo.

 

We believe that the little everyday things in life should be easy. Really easy.

That's why we build products that solve the everyday problems and are quick and easy to use - giving you your time back to spend on other things (like climbing mountains, roasting chestnuts or whatever else takes your fancy).

Our latest pride and joy is called Nimble, the world's first safe to use one finger cutting tool. Nimble makes cutting open packets and parcels - and slicing sticky tape and wrapping paper - quicker and easier than ever!

Nimble is a small and versatile tool that can be worn on the fingertip like a thimble and uses a small but safe blade to cut thin paper and thin plastic items.
column8: >Nimble is great for crafting and present-wrapping too
column10:
/>

 

Nimble is One-Size-Fits-All

Nimble's special sleeve profile expands and contracts to fit all finger sizes so you don't have to worry which size to get.

 

 

 

It Has Been Thoroughly Tested by 150 Volunteers

Nimble was been tested thoroughly at home by 150 volunteers to make sure it's up to the job. The feedback we got from them blew us away!
column11:
>150 people tested Nimble to help make it the best it can be

 

 

 

 

We Kept Going Until We Had It Juuust Right

We made countless prototypes throughout Nimble's development to ensure we got the design just right. Here are just a few...
column12: >Just some of the prototypes we built along the way
column15: >Here are the awesome Nimble perks on offer. Whether you want to try one out or get a bunch to share with friends and family there's an option for you.
column16: >Hint: the postage works out cheaper per Nimble if you get more as Nimble is nice and compact!
column17:
>Everything's a party when Nimble's around!

 

 

 

 

How do I use Nimble?

1. Place on your fingertip with Nimble's head pointing down.

2. Hold item to be cut in your other hand or rest it on a Nimble Cutting Mat.

3. Apply pressure and draw a line to make a cut, with your finger at a 45° angle.

You should be able to cut through a few sheets of standard printing paper and most thin plastics, such as those used for packaging in kitchen and home items.

How do I use Nimble safely?

Nimble is a great alternative to knives and scissors, as it's a much safer option when opening annoying packaging around the home. On thicker, softer skin, Nimble's blade is small enough for the skin to bend around the small blade, but on tighter and more frail skin you will likely cause a cat scratch when pressing hard*.

* Disclaimer: We suggest that you do not apply Nimble directly or indirectly to skin. Although Nimble is safer than most knives and scissors, we wouldn't recommend that you actively try to hurt yourself to test Nimble's safety.

Nimble will be shipping from the UK, so you should expect the following delivery times from dispatch:
column20:
>INT: 5-7 business days

We do not currently offer tracking for our shipping.

If you're looking to return a faulty or incorrect item, please get in touch by sending an email to indiegogo@version22.com so we can get this sorted for you. Please quote your Order Number, Full Name, a description of the issue, and include any photos that will help us help you. We will then take it from there.

If the product is being returned because it is faulty or because it has arrived with the packaging damaged, then it is eligible for a refund. We will ask you to return your order back to our office in the UK, and the refund will be determined through product testing. When the returned product is received and tested, a refund for both the product and return shipping will then be issued if appropriate.

If you change your mind about the product, you are welcome to return it but at your own cost and in the condition in which you received it, complete with original, intact packaging. We do not offer exchanges for different items.

We will only accept refunds within 28 days of dispatch, and if accepted, your refund will be processed within 7 business days.

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for regular updates and the occasional giveaway. You can also subscribe to our weekly newsletter on our website where we share our 2 favourite things from the internet that week and a little something extra.

column1: We did it! With your help, we reached our funding goal, and beyond.
Great job everyone! We reached the goal! Every funder at the $49 level and higher received 1 free Proto Shield in their perk shipment. Go build cool stuff!

Awesome! We're upgrading all Pinoccio boards to the ATmega256RFR2 microcontroller. It’s lower-power when receiving on the mesh network (it uses way less battery), and it has double the flash memory — 256k instead of the original 128k listed on our specs. Double up!

Every Pinoccio is wireless - Every Pinoccio Scout has a rechargeable battery and a built-in radio for mesh networking. Scouts talk to each other wirelessly and have a range similar to your home's wireless router.

WiFi made easy - Easily connect projects to the Web over WiFi. Your Scout will be talking to the Web within minutes of unboxing. You only need one Lead Scout — the Scout with a WiFi backpack — to connect dozens of Scouts to the Web. The WiFi shield also has a micro SD card slot for logging data.
Arduino-compatible  - Yep! You can use the Arduino IDE to program Pinoccio Scouts. The code for many existing Arduino projects will work with Pinoccio.

Mesh networking - Connect multiple Pinoccio boards to the Web wirelessly, all via one Pinoccio Lead Scout. If you have a Scout that's out of WiFi range, the others will route its data up to the Web.

Rechargeable battery included - Every board has a LiPo battery that charges via micro USB. A single charge lasts days to weeks — even months on a single charge (depends on how you're using the boards).

An API - A free, real-time, streaming REST API. Use our API, or roll your own, it's up to you. Our API lets you stream data out of each and every Scout. That means you'll be notified instantly when something changes (pin values, LED, temperature, etc). You can also stream your own reports through the API, and effortlessly query historical data.

Pinoccio HQ - Push code updates over-the-air using our light-weight scripting language called ScoutScript. No more waiting to compile and upload. Just type led.red and watch your Scout's LED turn red immediately, all wireless. Send commands from anywhere in the world.

Open source  - Pinoccio is open-source hardware, which means that you can download the schematics, the board layout, and the bootloaders and do with it what you like. We host all of our files on the Github page.

A community - The Pinoccio Community is a place where you can share ideas, projects, code, help each other out, and collaborate on projects.  Want to join the discussion?  The community forums are open!
Pinoccio has similar specs to the Arduino Mega.
• Atmel ATmega128RFA1 microcontroller at 16MHz and 128k of flash
• 550mAh LiPo rechargeable battery, rechargeable via the USB jack
• 17 digital I/O pins, including four with PWM
Detailed tech specs

Produce the first run of boards - We've been prototyping via small — and expensive — batches of boards. We're currently on our 9th revision, the hardware is dialed in, and we're ready for you to start building on Pinoccio. However, the only way to make Pinoccio affordable for everyone is to do a large production run of the boards. $50,000 is the minimum amount we need for assembly and manufacture of the first run of boards.

With our perks, you'll be the first wave of Makers, Artists, Musicians, Hackers, and Educators to build on the Pinoccio platform. We strongly recommend the Pinoccio Starter Kit at $149. With the Starter Kit, you'll get 2 Pinoccio Scouts — each with its own rechargeable LiPo battery, 1 WiFi backpack, and 1 micro USB cable for charging. You can start building any number of interesting wireless projects with the Pinoccio Starter Kit.

Shipping outside the U.S.
For International Shipping of rewards $49 and up, you'll need to add an extra $12. How do you add this money? When you select a contribution level, you'll be prompted to enter the total contribution amount just below. Add the $12 to the cost of the reward there.

What if I forgot to add the $12 for international shipping?
After the project is funded and we're ready to ship, we'll contact each contributor to confirm shipping details. If you didn't add shipping when you contributed, you can add it then.

Eric Jennings is a TechStars NYC alum with a ton of startup experience. He’s into hacking pretty much anything he can get his hands on: music, the environment, the brain, and the agora. His background is in writing software, but he has a soft spot for open-source hardware. Regardless of the tools, his passion lies in breaking open old, stagnant industries.

Sally Carson is a User Experience Designer with over a decade of Tech Industry experience. She’s worked with companies including Yahoo, the George Lucas Educational Foundation, Crutchfield, and Lynda.com. She’s also cartoonist, a retired NYC bicycle messenger, one time she rode her bike from Canada to Miami to raise money for Hospice. That was hard. She was listening to R. Kelly's ""I'm a Flirt"" when she wrote this.

Most of you know I've been doing street medic stuff for a long time
column2: I started doing it in 2004 so that's about 8 years or so. I am planning to go to the G8/NATO conference happening this May 19th-22nd to support people with my knowledge of emergency medicine and first aid. I believe very strongly in the need for medical support in states of exception, where the existing societal support networks fail to work. Which is more often than not at convergences like the G8. I'm a little worried about having the money to get there and back considering I haven't been able to get work recently. Or anytime in recent memory, really. So basically I'm sparechanging over the internet.

column1: EDIT Y'ALL: So the G8 has been moved out of Chicago. The NATO conference is still happening, and protests are still happening, so I'm still going. The end.
Also, I've been struggling to fund an art project that involves lighting myself on fire. So I'm combining the two.

There are several methods I can use to light myself on fire, some more spectacular than others. The most interesting one is (of course) the most complicated and expensive. I've already put more than $150 into the fire project and it's not something I can continue while I don't have a steady income. I shelved lighting myself on fire for about 3 months because of lack of funds but resurrected it because it seemed like a great way to say thank you. Also, it's really freakin' cool.
If you are unfamiliar with street medics and what we do, I would recommend this article: Anarchistic and Self-Trained Are Street Medics the Future of First Aid?
""Errico"" (quoted in the article) is a longtime comrade and was part of the disaster relief team I worked with in Haiti.
If you are interested in street medic protocols there is a street medic wiki: http://medic.wikia.com/
If you are unfamiliar with what the G8 is: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G8

column2: DR? The G8 is a meeting where the richest countries in the world congratulate each other on being rich and discuss how to stay rich. It is a closed meeting with no accountability.

column1: Chicago gets another experienced street medic and Wilderness EMT during a very important and in my opinion almost sure to be a dangerous and pivotal convergence. Also, you get to see me light myself on fire.
Anything I don't use on G8 travel or immolation supplies will be donated to either getting other medics to the G8, directly to the clinic at the G8, or to legal and prisoner support.
Travel and food and first aid supplies will be the bulk of what donations will be spent on, with supplies for a successful and safe self immolation coming second.
You get to see me light myself on fire.

Actually, this idea came out of wanting to have a gallery opening of my photos of arson. While trying to plan something more interesting than just a gallery opening where everyone gets drunk while pretending they're not bored I thought it might be fun to invite fire performers. Then I was all
column2: ""Why don't I light myself on fire?"" Because that was a completely logical thought, I proceeded to research different ways to do it, and enlisted the help of several amazing and helpful people along the way.

column1: Fire performers are still invited, and there might be surprises as well. Consider that an open call to bring your poi and staffs and whatever else you play with.

Support access to healthcare for all people in your community, make art, support art, educate yourself and others about anti-oppression strategies, just straight up educate yourself (the internet is an amazing resource, so are libraries), follow the first unwritten rule of anarchy (don't be a douchebag), and we always need tech support.

column5: >1) It is not hygienic to wash the dirty cloths used for mopping the floors, toilets and kitchen platforms in the regular washing machine. Use VENUS to wash them separately in a bucket which later can easily be cleaned and disinfected.

column1: 2) Children love to play in the mud and cleaning such clothes in the regular washing machines leaves a mess behind inside the tub. Cleaning this mess is an avoidable tiresome chore. Use VENUS for such washes.
3) Wash infant’s messy clothes without fear of contaminating regular laundry.
5) Use VENUS to wash clothes that leak/shed color.
6) People who are often on the road like salesman, can carry this compact machine and wash clothes easily in hotel bathrooms, thus saving money!!!
VENUS easily fits in a small backpack
